Logitech has lighter weight and that matter alot. This is longer and heavier, not that i am weak but this gives annoying feel. I compared Motorola and logitech, this is better than motrolla but not better than logitech.

Had purchased the cool looking bendable mouse for my Surface but returned it. This is the next option and so Happy with it. I can hold it correctly and not be afraid to break or fold. It’s sleek looking too. Recommend.

With a low profile and color matching my new Apple MacBook, I have a practical mouse that has style too. I did not want to burden the Mac with a USB dongle, so Bluetooth was the way to go. Great buy on a great mouse.

Very smooth and comfortable when using it! I am a full time student and I am constantly working on my personal computer, so this really eliminates the stress of using the generic mouse that comes with my surface pro!

Lightweight and portable, with a redesigned wheel optimized for great scrolling, plus dongle-free Bluetooth connectivity, the new Surface Mobile Mouse works on virtually any surface¹ thanks to BlueTrack technology.

I originally got the MS Arc Mouse with my Surface Pro, but wanted something with a better "wheel" for scrolling, this mouse works perfectly for that and is compact enough to fit in the slipcover for my Surface pro.

I purchased this for my surface while on vacation because I forgot the original one at home (the tiny black mouse). This is very responsive, easy to set up and even better than the original. I highly recommend it.

Very easy to set up, worked out of the box on my Macbook Pro. Unfortunately, it wasn't very comfortable so I ended up returning it. I'm recommending it, but make sure you spend some time with it before you buy it.
Compliment you and your team for offering my wife a product which she need, and I must say that she is very much satisfied with its performance. I will recommend my friends to come to your store

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This mouse is small easy to use and goes well with the surface laptop. My only gripe is it doesn’t have an off button so it’s on all the time even in my bag when my laptop is off
It’s very thin so it’s easily very mobile. Goes great with my 2 in 1 and packs away easily. But I wouldn’t want to use it for long periods or anything intensive. Nice quality and good looking.
I was looking into buying my wife a new mouse for her new Microsoft Surface Go. I bought her this, and loved it so much I bought it for my Mac as well. The Apple mouse is way too overpriced.
Easy set up and connects instantly every time after. Batteries last a very long time. This is my second mouse ordered first two years ago for work still works using this one for my house.
Has been working well, its a mouse!  One occasion where communication was lost, it came back.  The blue track is nice, I have used it on a blanket on the couch. It is comfortable in hand.
Needed a portable mouse for our HP Spectre laptop and this was perfect. It matched the sleek design of the laptop, but for a more reasonable price. Looks and feels great. Works perfectly.
The mouse is light, slim, and simple. I love how it's not bulky or feels like it's too much. It makes it easier to use with my laptop to navigate quicker. Set up was as easy as it can be.
I was using my other mouse and then decided to purchase this one, which I like very much. Fits the hand comfortably, has bluetooth,, so very easy to install and I like the shape and size
It was great for 2 years. Now, I have trouble dragging and dropping items, clicking on tabs, doing any design work, etc. Wish Microsoft would fix it without me having to buy a new mouse.
Actually use this on a device other than my surface book. It's small and easy to carry in my bag.. It's a bluetooth mouse so it will connect to any PC that has bluetooth with no issues.
When using my laptop, this mouse works seamless with any OS I use, (obviously as it is bluetooth) with little to no issues. The sleek design is both attractive and comfortable to hold.
I love this mouse for my Surface Go. It is flat and small so it fits into a small space in my tote. It is responsive and easy to pair. Lots of color choices, but I went with silver.
this mouse way better then the Microsoft ARC mouse I received with my new Surface Pro. I use this when I travel for work and I really like it. For the price it will not disappoint.

Works Great.
Bluetooth works with iPad 7th Generation.
Slim design fits in thin tablet case.
Only drawback is you must turn it off. It does NOT time out and turn of automatically.
I never had a bluetooth mouse this works instantly with my Chromebook. I have not noticed any problems at all. Works with Windows and Chromebook. Best part is no dongle to carry.
This is a classy mouse. I bought it to go with my new big ASUS computer. it is blue tooth and doesn't use a usb slot and is a pleasure to use. Sleekest blue tooth I could find.
I got this to go with my surface pro because I wanted to free up the usb plug in spot. I was skeptical at first, but it works really well, very responsive. Worth every penny!!
This works great with my surface. It was easy to set up and the greatest part is it doesn’t take a usb connector. It’s totally Bluetooth wireless and leaves the USB port free.
cant live without a mouse for these new laptops and this mouse is easy and simple to use. Only draw back to me is that its a little to flat on top--just used to a bulkier one
Purchased this mouse to use in conjunction with the MS surface book 3. Has worked great thus far and much easier to use than the track pad when doing lots of word processing.
Purchased this mouse as an alternative to using the trackpad for my Microsoft products. It is very easy to use and allows me to navigate just as easily as using the trackpad.
I got two for 20$. The deal was good. Its little flat though. So your pawn does not fit on to it. Thats a little concern. I hope my pawn would used to it someday. We’ll see!
I returned this immediately after trying to use it for 5 minutes.  I loved the bluetooth connect, that was about it.  It was not ergonomical at all and hurt my hand to use.
I highly recommend this mouse. This mouse is portable and has a long lifetime battery life. I have not yet had to change the batteries out. I have had it for over a year.

Microsoft outdid themselves on this.
It connected seamlessly to my ASUS laptop. 
The battery has lasted me 5 months which is much longer than I get with most other mice.
Great tool when not at my home office. The mouse is slim and compact. The reason for 4 stars vs 5: it is too slim for my personal liking. I'm used to an ergonomic mouse.
Its a good portable mouse.  My only complaint is that even when I turn off the laser, sometimes I find it back on again.  What is wrong with a good old fashioned switch?
This product is designed well for travel capability but had too much lag in Bluetooth connections.  tried driver updates and setting changes but did not make any better
Excellent addition to my Surface Pro7. Bluetooth pairing is a breeze, and it handles beautifully with my Asus laptop as well. I like the low profile and the simplicity.
Sometimes fingers and stylus don’t do the job. This mouse is a wonderful accessory. It works on my Surface and my iPad. It’s sturdy and the batteries last a long time,
Mouse performs well and is very compact. If you don't like the clicking sound of a mouse, then you should look at other more silent mice. Otherwise, I do recommend it.
Descent mouse, compact and efficient. Only problem, battery compartment closes with magnetic latch, so if you drop the mouse the lid flies off along with the batteries
I like it. Works well. Only minor complaint is that it takes maybe 3 to 5 seconds to connect after its been idle for awhile. But this is common for all bluetooth mice.
I started working from home and needed something a mouse since I'd be on more laptop more often. I've only had it a couple of months, but so far it's worked perfectly!
I needed a new mouse that would work and track well. I bought this mouse, unpacked it and paired it and started working. The whole process took less than five minutes
Bluetooth connectivity works great, fits well in the hand. It’s not quite as ergonomically designed as the other Microsoft mouse, but for the price you can’t beat it.
It’s not quite as ergonomically designed as the other Microsoft mouse, but for the price you can’t beat it. Bluetooth connectivity works great, fits well in the hand.
Its a ok mouse very smooth in my hands. The feel of it is great.  However It does burn through batteries so a rechargeable AAA port might be the best option to use.
delivery timeframe ridiculously slow..has been over two weeks, had this been disclosed up front, would have purchased elsewhere particularly of an item i use daily.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this mouse.  Since I am a person that very little about computers all I had to do was take off the little paper from the batteries and it installed by itself.
It came with batteries included, I like that it doesn’t use a usb to connect it is completely wireless. Easy to hold in hand, its very responsive and good overall.
Bought this mouse to use with my MacBook Air and iPad. It was really easy to pair. The build quality on this is great and it is half the price of the Apple mouse.
It only works with the Microsoft Surface so that makes it frustrating having multiple devices this doesn't work with.  But it works really great with the surface.
I purchased the Surface Mouse for my Surface Go and I am so happy I did! Never skips or slow easy to sync and the batteries last forever. Very responsive mouse .
Works well, but can a little too small in the hand to stay in place when you click. Very portable small size, but if you have a larger hand, get a bigger mouse.
Good mouse for the price. I use it a lot so it only lasted just under 2 years before the wheel started to act up. Other that that wheel issue it has been great
Maybe they should make more hardware. This is head and shoulders above other Bluetooth mice I’ve used. I love that it sleeps then wakes on movement flawlessly.
The ease of setup and performance is outstanding for Surface Pro and any other blue tooth device.  Have two now and replaced the other that came with a laptop.
I have this and and arc mouse for my Surface Go, and I prefer this one. The physically scroll wheel is nicer, it's cheaper and it's almost compact at the arc.

Great little mouse for traveling with my laptop. Love everything about it except that once in awhile I have to do move it around to find where the cursor went or wake it up or reconnect it again. Not a big issue.

Needed a mouse that wont require a USB connector, and found this great option.  Was able to price match and got a great deal.  Been using it for a few months now and it connects immediately and works as expected.

Love this mouse, especially because it is Bluetooth and not having to add a dongle in a USB. If there's one downside to it is that the clicks (left & right) are just a little loud. Scroll is very nice and quiet.

This mouse is actually very good. I use it with my Mac and I find it is far better than the Apple Magic mouse. It doesn't lose its Bluetooth connection as often and I find that it is more comfortable to use too.

I like this Surface Mouse over the other one but I like the "old fashion" real buttons and roller feel better personally the price isn't too bad either relatively on par with other quality mouses on the market.

I like that this mouse is small and portable, and it’s Bluetooth so no dongle needed to plug into your device, it uses batteries which I like instead of plugging it in to charge, works great and is comfortable

I wanted to obtain a mouse I could use when I don't feel like using my touch pad (which is most of the time). This mouse serves it's purpose very well and didn't break the bank. Plus it just looks really cool!

bought this to use with my Surface Book 2, I returned it.  it is an ok mouse, little spendy for basic mouse functions.  it is built well.
exchanged it for Microsoft - Surface Precision Bluetooth Optical Mouse

I bought this mouse 6 months after I purchased my surface. 
I used to use the pen all the time, but with the mouse and keyboard, my surface eliminate the need to be on my Laptop. 

Battery life lasts forever.

What can I say about a mouse -- it's a mouse!  Not one I am used to, where I have buttons and resolutions that would blow this mouse out of the water, but it's the wife's and she seems to be happy with it.

I use it with my Surface Laptop 2, other more expensive Microsoft mouses just didn't suit me, and often had lag or would disconnect.  This one is very basic, but it does the job for me, and no complaints.

Love this, great response on any surface using it with blue-tooth. My other wireless mouse uses an USB and is real skidish on many surfaces and from just 4' away from the source. Nice fit to the hand too.

I love this mouse. It works well and connected immediately to my computer with little work. The mouse is super quick at recognizing touch and movement. Definitely you should get this if you want a mouse.

I tried another brand of bluetooth mouse with Surface and it did not work well. I purchased the Microsoft Surface mouse after giving up on the the "universal mouse" and it works seamless with my Surface.

Smal l& Flat easy to put into case with out a big bulge & trying to close your case. BUT IS STILL A GOOD FIT FOR LARGER HANDS.
As Far as performance it works Great, with just about any Desktop or Laptop

I wasn't sure I would like a "flat" mouse but it fits amazingly well into the hand and is a perfect match for the surface pro.  Connected with no issues and has worked on virtually every surface so far.

Nice and slim so it travels well slipping into a pocket on the case I have. Connects instantly via Bluetooth so you don't have a dongle using up the USB port and it tracks seamlessly. Highly recommend.
Awesome wireless mouse, pairs easily with Bluetooth. Speed of mouse adjustable to your liking. Has right, left and scrolling button. Nothing too fancy but fits hand nicely and has a sleek look to it.
simply a great mouse  I know it may sound silly but this is just a great mouse  i use it with my surface pro and it connects ALWAYS  iv never had a single hiccup with it and the resolution is spot on

I have only had this mouse for a couple days, but I can tell you it works great and looks beautiful. Also, it is very sturdy. 

I accidentally dropped this mouse down the stairs (ooops) and it bounced like 8 steps before hitting the floor (I have wood floors and wood stairs, btw) and there was only a tiny scuff on the left corner of the mouse from what I assume was the initial impact. You won't even notice it unless you already know it's there. It hit really hard. I panicked and thought I completely broke the mouse, but nope, still perfectly fine other than that tiny scuff. I just had to pop the batteries back in and the back cover to the batteries and it was all good to go. 

I've used it on my Surface Book 2 and even on my iPad Pro and it works flawlessly. I was a little sad that it was $30+, but hey, I've spent more on gaming mouses (mice?) that do not look as aesthetically pleasing. The clicking isn't quiet but it isn't too loud. It actually sounds kinda nice to me and the scrolling is smooth.

I would recommend it to people looking for a simple, yet beautiful mouse for portability.
This mouse died, almost a year to the date it was purchased. It worked pretty well, up until, today. My 11 y.o. son uses it (along with his Surface Pro) for school and the timing couldn't be worse.

The battery cover is held on by magnets, so it sometimes comes off in my bag; and the power button is not the easiest to push.

But it's slim, comfortable to hold and doesn't take up the usb slot.
I bought two. One works great on my Surface Go 2 tablet. The other one simply sucks on my laptop. I threw it in the drawer to give it to one of the grandkids, and drug out my old Microsoft mouse.
The Microsoft Mobile Mouse connect flawlessly the only thing i wish it had was a Back and Forth button, plus it would of been nice to have a On/Off switch so you don't drain the battery as quick.
Bought this to go with my Surface. Nice, compact design. The only problem (my issue, not the product) is I prefer the feel of a trackball. Needed something more compact so this is almost perfect.

Nice and compact for travel. This mouse is well built and feels premium. I strictly use this when I travel with my laptop, but at home and stationed it's paired with a full sized gaming mouse. I love that's it's Bluetooth and I don't have to worry about losing a USB receiver.

I was excited to get and use this mouse because I wanted a silver one and I wanted a really well built mouse without issues.
But first of all the mouse is more white than silver, and plus sometimes the laser has issues and has lag or doesn't respond even with a mouse pad.

This was a perfect companion for my wife's laptop since it doesn't have USB A to connect a wireless mouse, the Microsoft - Surface Mobile Mouse - Silver came in hand since it is Bluetooth, despite it being a surface mobile mouse it worked well with a Samsung laptop

The mouse does its job. Nice design and easy to use.  Better than even the arch mouse I also have from MS that from time to time makes the scrolling difficult. With this mouse, there is not ever a problem and the battery lasts long for sure. Good product for sure.

Very uncomfortable size and shape. Might be ok if I didn't have a pinky finger that healed poorly after a bone break but I doubt it. Can't recommend unless you have small hands and need a super portable mouse for the rare situation that you require/desire a mouse.

This might be a duplicate because I bought two of these, but this is a great low profile mouse. The Bluetooth pairing means you keep a USB port open and it's great for office use. I wouldn't use it for gaming or anything, but it beats a trackpad and travels well.

Slim sleek and easy to use.  Doesnt hurt my hand.

What I really love about this mouse was that it was not a pain in the butt at all to connect via Bluetooth with Windows 10.  Bluetooth in the old days was not worth the purchase.  This has flawless dependability.

I bought this product to match with my Surface keyboard. It works well but I noticed it sometimes stops working after a while as if it is making sure you are still using it in order to turn on again which can get annoying at times. Otherwise it is a great Mouse.

This mouse works great. Battery life is excellent and I have no issues with it connected as soon as I turn my computer on. I use it several hours at a time for school work and no issues with my hand cramping or connectivity. Super fast and easy to set up too!

Really convenient and smooth mouse. I like it as a work mouse when traveling or moving from workstation to another.  Bluetooth connection is a huge plus. Not as comfortable and ergonomic so take into consideration when working for long stretches of time.

This Bluetooth-enabled mobile mouse replaces a mouse that required a USB-C connection.  This conveniently opens a port on the laptop for additional inputs such as thumb drives.  It perfectly matches the laptop computer color and fits well with the hand.

Love this mouse.  I always hated the USB receiver sticking out of my laptop on other wireless mice and this mouse eliminates the receiver. It's also slim, light and comfortable in my hand. It's sold as a Surface mouse but I use it with my HP laptop.

Works great.  I love it!  It runs smooth, it is light weight, you just push the button on the bottom to turn it off to save the battery life when you are not using it,  and when you turn it back on it re-connects immediately.  I am glad I bought it.

This is a must have for your surface pro if you are using the keyboard. Nice low profile. Connects via blue-tooth so no extra dongles. Batteries last for ever. Choice of colors if you prefer.

Like all Microsoft products the price could be better.

Have for work and personal use and works great.  Long battery life and once connected via Bluetooth it always "just works".  Have 3 in the house connected to 3 different laptops and never any confusion between devices or any connectivity problems.

Nice efficient and functional design. Plus a true silver color that matches up nicely with a silver laptop, either a Mac or PC. Comfortable to use, looks good, and priced right. Love the color options available but silver is especially the best.

This Microsoft Bluetooth mouse pairs & matches perfectly with my Surface Book Pro 4. It has a nice sleek profile that makes it easy to travel with. I've had no issues pairing the mouse at all. A little on the pricier side, but I got it on sale.

For the price this is a very good Bluetooth mouse. Made from high quality plastic. It is slightly small and not that comfortable compared to the top mouse from Microsoft. However, for the price you can't go wrong if you don't have a large hand.

Great value for a bluetooth mouse.  It works very well, has a nice ergonomic feel in the hand, and it has a nice slim profile.  Definitely a good choice to accompany your Surface device or any mobile device when you want a thin bluetooth mouse.

Easy to connect to your laptop. Its very light and has no delay of movement. It fits good in your bag. I have a small hand so it works great into my hand. It is a little flat. It does not have a big curve but it works perfect. 

Great purchase

Unless you are looking for something that is for a larger handed person, this mouse fits well in your hand and doesn’t have the inconvenience of a usb connection. Great for computers with Bluetooth capability and lacking many usb connections.

This mouse is perfect. Works great with my Surface Pro. I've actually dropped it several times when I've been moving my Surface from room to room and it still works perfectly. I've left it on for days and battery is still good. So worth it!

Not saying this is a bad mouse, but I could not get this thing to pair with a 15" 2018 MacBook Pro. It would say it's "connected" but it didn't work at all. So it's going back. I wrote this review to maybe save someone a little aggravation.

Connected instantly to my new windows laptop via bluetooth. No USB dongle needed. It's not the most comfortable mouse I have ever used, but it is very portable because of its flat design and no issues with it after using it for two months.

The Microsoft Bluetooth mouse works perfectly with our Microsoft Surface Pro 6. Setup was easy and it responds much better than the traditional mouse with a USB dongle that uses up much needed USB ports. Would recommend it for any laptop.

The Microsoft Surface Mobile Mouse is a really nice addition to any portable setup. It is slim and lightweight making it nice to add in a pocket or bag to take with you for your laptop or tablet as it easily connects via Bluetooth without needing to worry about wires. The battery life seems to be great too so far as well.

Got it Jan 14, its not April 20 and my Surface is giving me the Surface Mobile Mouse battery is low. 12 months normal use, yah I'd say mine is normal use. And I only use it 5 days a week, when I'm not at work it doesn't get used. It also had Duracell batteries. I'd give it more stars if the batteries lasted longer.

I love this thing. Its light and easy to operate. One little Bluetooth button on the bottom turns it on and off and it runs off of AAA. I use this mouse to watch videos on my tablet in my office. Can't wait to get an office TV so I can connect my tablet to it and have a giant monitor controlled by this mouse!

A slick little mouse.  I wish it had an OFF switch, however it must have a good sleep and wake function as I haven't needed to change the battery yet.  Whenever I pick it up the blue light is flickering.   Does it ever turn off?   I'm glad it uses a regular battery instead of a non-replaceable rechargeable.

This mouse replaced a small travel model that got a little flaky after too many drops on the floor -- it would periodically drop its Bluetooth connection. I liked the old one -- but this one is even better. It's more solidly built, responds more smoothly, and looks really nice. Perfect for the Surface.

WORKS AS EXPECTED AND SO FAR HAS WORKED WELL EVEN ON GLASS SURFACE. AT FIRST I REMOVED ONE BATTERY FOR TRAVELING FEARING IT WILL BE TURNED ON ACCIDENTALLY IN THE BACK PACK, BUT LAST TWO WEEK I JUST TURN IT OFF AND CARRY IT THAT WAY AND HAS NOT TURNED ON ACCIDENTALLY. SO FAR IT HAS MET MY EXPECTATIONS.

It works well.  Set up is not straitforward, as it is with Apple's blue tooth mouse.  There is an issue with the Apple blue to mouse. The Apple MacBook mouse set up options do not all suppressing side to side motion moving the screen side to side that had me pursue the Microsoft Surfce Mobile Mouse.

I haven't had good luck with Bluetooth mice.  Every several minutes, the cursor sticks, and I have to wait a 3-5 seconds for it to free up again.  I went back to an old wireless mouse I had that has an "antenna" the connects to the computer through the USB port.  Anyway, I'm keeping it as a backup.

I don't mind using the touchpad on my Surface Pro but it is nice to have a mouse at times. I've used many wireless mice over the years and have found that you get what you pay for as far as responsiveness. This little guy was part of a bundle but I think runs about $34 and is well worth the money.

I love this mouse. The only thing, I wish it had an auto odd feature. I left it on and came back a few hours later and noticed the blue light was still blinking (I'm guessing it was trying to connect to a device). So now I'm in the habit of turning it off when I'm done using it for each session.

I was able to get on a deal of two for $30 and have no regrets. Great simple mouse for quick tasks on my macbook or windows device. I just have to keep repairing the mouse which I switch from one device to the other. Haven't figured out if it's possible to have it paired to two devices at once.

It is a good mouse, the only things is sometimes lost connection with the computer. And goes to sleep very fast to conserve battery wich is a good thing, except if goes to sleep in less than a minute. So is annoying.  No way to change configuration. Hey Microsoft, I don't mind to buy batteries!

Its great mouse and function smoothly but the only this i didnt like is the hand grip wich my hand start hurting after couple days because it puts restraint on the rest. I couldn’t get use to them. Plus they need some sort of a case for traveling so it doesn’t scrach in the bag with other stuff

If I did not have this mouse then I would hate myself. Its a little on the expensive side but after purchasing it I have not thought twice about returning it. Its nice and sleek and easy to use, also took no time at all to connect. If it ever disconnects then it takes 3 seconds to reconnect.

Microsoft has two things about this mouse that are good. The blue light works on glass and there is no bluetooth dongle. That said it feels cheaply made, does not track as well as some of their other products and feels like a cheap after thought for a good brand in Surface. Not recommended.

I had recently bought a Surface Pro 5. Then I bought the keyboard for it. The next thing is the Surface Mobile Mouse. It uses just two AAA batteries, and they come with it. The mouse is easy to slide, and the buttons are very sensitive to the touch. Also like using the scroll for websites.

Compact, sleek, works very well on just about any surface you can think of. Only complaint is that every once in a while the mouse stops responding and I have to pick up and put back down the mouse a few times, or move it around real fast, to get it to respond. It’s a minor thing though.

Not just wireless but a Bluetooth mouse. Bought this for my daughter to use for her Macbook pro. Didn't want to spend a whole lot for an apple mouse since she has a wireless mouse but Macbook doesn't have a usb connection so it was useless. This is a perfect addition and not too pricey.

I bought this fantastic mouse a couple of weeks ago, I use it with a Lenovo, pairing was straight forward. Design is great, small and slim enough to fit in any bag, but still good size to fit in the hand. It works perfect; buttons and wheel. Happy with my decision to go with this mouse.

Bought for my daughter to use with her surface book.  Nice little mouse that has smooth response and great feel.  I particularly love that is is a Bluetooth connection and not wireless requiring USB receivers.  Now all of her USB slots are open for attaching other devices as needed.

I bought this mouse on sale and it works great.  The wheel is smooth and quiet.  It took just a little bit to get used to the height of it since my other mouse is much taller (thicker?), this mouse is slim and sleek.  It immediately paired with my Surface. I really like this mouse.

I found the Microsoft - Surface Mobile mouse to be slow in response time.      The  style is aesthetically pleasing, smooth and sleek, but not ergo friendly for long term use.    Also, connectivity problems when setting up the blue tooth device. 

Disappointing purchase........

I generally like Microsoft mice.  I really like the new intellipro and I needed a wireless mouse for work and study on the go.  Initially purchased this wasn't super happy instead I got the more basic Microsoft wireless bluetooth mouse and for me it was a lot more comfortable.

I do like the look of this mouse. It is low profile and I will keep it to use on my smaller and more portable devices. However, it is not very comfortalbe. The scroll wheel feels cheap. The rest feels nice. The magnetic slider for the battery compartment on the bottom is nice.

may not be the cheapest mouse out there or even necessary but i wanted it to make it easier to browse when my surface go is hooked up to my tv. I have big hands so not very ergonomical but it looks slick and compact and its wireless. matches with my other microsoft accessories
Great purchase, works really well. Would recommend.

I have had this mouse for a couple of weeks and I am really liking the little thing. I don't use it all the time, just for a little bit with my Surface after work, but I'm not spending any serious time with it or using it for work. So, I like that it is small and thin and doesn't require a separate little USB connector that my previous wireless mice (?) have required. The slim design and Bluetooth connectivity make it very portable. I haven't had to worry about the battery since I started using it. I don't think it's the most ergonomically correct design, but since I'm not using it for prolonged periods of time I'm not really too worried about it.

I've worked with computers for decades, and have worked with countless mice (mouses? meeces?) over the years. The main issue with this mouse is the loud click of the button. It is a low pitched loud distracting sound! The Surface Pro only has two USB ports, one a USB-C and one USB-A. Logitech is my favorite, but it would occupy the USB-A port. And I would not trust other bluetooth mice due to reports of connectivity issues. Also, the mouse is really not very ergonomic, but does look sleek. The bluetooth pairing was amazingly quick. All told, I've decided to ignore the loud clicks and keep this device. I think I'll just wear my Bose noise-cancelling headset! :)

Bought to use with my Microsoft Surface. It’s sized right fit in a laptop bag, yet shaped well to fit in the hand. Good compromise. Good size for small hands I’m told. 

Buttons and wheel have good feel/response. 

Bluetooth connected right up and there have been no issues with its connection. 

There is no switch to power it off/on, it’s motion activated to turn on. After 4 months the battery still holds up, but I only use it 1-2 days a week. Battery drain has not been an issue for me. If you frequently move your bag where the mouse vibrates or is in motion to activate it, your’s may be ‘on’ much more than mine,

Mouse works fine. I'll have to get use to it being a little short, but that's what makes it convenient for travel. The color is supposed to be silver, and that's what's shown on the box, but it is a light gray and does not match my silver laptop.

as the whole idea of having Surface Pro is portability. 
That's why I opted in for sleek Arc mouse when I first purchased my Surface Pro. 

It turned out, Arc mouse sucks. I like the idea of storing it flat and all but it's just awkward to hold it, and use it. Instead, I've been using Logitech MX Anywhere 2S for my portable needs however, it is bit chunkier than Arc mouse.

Enter Surface Mobile Mouse, it's slim enough for tightly packing in my portable gear setup, yet it's functional, somewhat ergonomically, and has premium feels and touch to it. 

Bluetooth connectivity works perfect. I do want it to have multiple device connectivities with bluetooth and usb dongle but I am happy as it is. Highly recommended.
Very cheap feeling mouse and not ergonomic atall. Matches my Surface Device. The scroll wheel is good quality and works well. The optics and hence mouse sensitivity is good.
Love my new Bluetouth mouse, connects smootly and works perfectly, the only issue is that it's small in my hand but on the other it makes it easy to carry.
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works well with my macbook pro! Its bluetooth paired and uses 2 AAA batteries. Fits the grasp of my hand perfectly.

This mouse looks sleek which is why I bought it in the first place. It just doesn't feel good in your hand. It's too flat and small, and doesn't have the right contour. The scroller is thin and has no grip.

The materials feel plastic-y and cheap, I think if you dropped it it would shatter into pieces. You can feel/hear this when you click the buttons. The bottom does not glide well on flat surfaces or mouse pads (I've tried both). Instead it feels like you're scratching the bottom when you move it. The Bluetooth connectivity is very spotty, it goes in and out.

I got this mouse for my MacBook as it's one of the cheaper bluetooth mouse that I can fine which resembles the look of an Apple Magic Mouse.  Of course it doesn't have all the gesture supports of a Magic Mouse, but it works well and tracks well with most desktop surfaces that I've used on.  My main complaint though is that similar to the Magic Mouse, this mouse is too flat and it doesn't feel comfortable on your hand for extended use.  But it does fit very well in a slim laptop sleeve that I use for holding my MacBook, if that's something that matters to you.

With my elementary school kids (1st and 5th grade) needing to use PCs full time for remote learning, I wanted to get them a mouse to use in lieu of the of the trackpads on our surface devices.  While the trackpads work ok, it's just plain easier to navigate and type with a mouse.

The Surface Mouse does not disappoint.  It connects almost immediately after booting up the PC, it has very smooth tracking and ergonomically is very easy to hold.  My wife liked it so much, we ended up buying another one for her HP laptop - which connects just as quickly.  Definitely a worthwhile purchase considering the price.

My only nitpick is that it doesn't automatically turn off.  It's supposed to have good battery life, but I end up turning it off every night....just in case.

I purchased the Microsoft mouse for its economical value.  The mouse works great on almost any surface.  It does not work 100% on rough, textured tables.  The cursor seems to drag or lag when I use the mouse in rough or textured surfaces.  All other aspects of the mouse work great!  You can turn off the mouse by simply pressing the Bluetooth button located at the bottom of the mouse and it quickly connects to my Microsoft Surface Pro when I turn the mouse on.  Great product for its value!

This is a truly excellent "mobile" mouse -- it is big enough to use like you would with any other mouse, but small and light enough to fit in whatever bag you might carry your computer and this mouse within. It is smaller than "normal" mice in the very best dimension -- it simply isn't as "thick" or "tall" as most regular mice. That allows it to fit in bags nicely, while still resulting in a mouse that's as easy to use as any "normal" mouse. It is also has absolutely excellent build quality -- this is a premium mouse in every way. I guess it's also worth mentioning that Microsoft offers this mouse in a number of different colors -- for instance, I bought a silver-colored one to go along with my silver-colored notebook computer. I sure like that better than using one of the far more usual black-colored mice.

If you’re looking for a fairly inexpensive wireless mouse, this is your best bet! I love that it matches my other Microsoft products. The ease of connecting to my surface book was seamless. The clicks aren’t too loud either which was a concern of mine. If you’re trying to decide between this mouse and the Arc mouse, you need to know they serve different functions. If you’re used to the normal grip of a mouse, go with this one (and if you don’t want to dish out $80, yikes!)

In all honesty, the best mouse I have ever purchased! It works very well and smooth with Bluetooth technology, no messy wires, and is a perfect match for my HP Envy Laptop. Very sleek design and it fits perfectly in my hand, not big and bulky like some others I have used. Very comfortable to use, especially when sitting at the computer for hours at a time. Others I have used have actually caused my hand to cramp up at times, whereas this one doesn’t. It’s a perfect fit!

This is an excellent mouse for any Windows 10 computer. It is meant for the Microsoft Surface tablet, which is why it is a more slim, compact mouse, but I use it for my Windows 10 desktop and love it. It is Bluetooth, so no USB dongle, and it connected to my computer automatically. Excellent product for the $35 pricetag. I feel it is a superior product to the under-$20 mice, and worth the money. Will buy again if needing another mouse in the future.

Got this with my new Pro 7.  It is quite a bit smaller then my old mouse, so it took some getting used to.  I have bigger hands and was used to the mouse fitting into the palm of my hand.  I've used this mouse for a couple days now and really like it.  It is made of quality materials, the scroll wheel is very smooth, and the buttons are easy to push.  I got this for free with all the other stuff I bought for my new Surface.  So it's even better.

Pairing with surface was as easy as a box popping up once I pulled up the tab out of the battery asking if I was trying to connect a Bluetooth mouse and pushing yes. No on/off on mouse and battery pack cover is magnetic rather than screw which is a nice touch. Mouse is responsive and buttons feel great. My only gripe is that I would really have enjoyed a rechargeable version of this via USB rather than the old school double AA battery reliance.

We like the streamlined design, but this mouse only works sporadically. It's not the batteries, we use new batteries. It wont work for a couple of minutes, then start working again. Then stop at some point. We'll be in the middle of looking for something online and the mouse will just stop working. It is the worst mouse we have ever bought. And, it's not old, we've only had it since maybe April. Very disappointed with it's poor reliability.

This is adequate. It's kind of flat so it doesn't feel very ergonomic. I mouses smoothly. The on/off is a tiny button that is flush with the underside so you will need a pen or pencil to turn it on and off easily. So far it has been able to take a beating. I travel with mine so it gets dropped and tossed into the carrying case on a regular basis. The bluetooth set up was easy. No need to tie up a usb port. Its a little pricey for a mouse.

I bought this mouse and a case for my wife's Microsoft Surface Go and it is nice. I like the bluetooth technology and how smooth the scrolling is. I have a MacBook Pro and obviously the only available options for the MPB is Apples own Magic Mouse 2 way over priced. There are a ton of options out there that are more than capable of working with the MBP and I found one in this mouse. I tested it and it works just fine so I bought another.

I love this mouse. It is a great portable mouse that I leave in my backpack. There is a super simple pairing method and it just works! It feels lightweight, but not cheap. The scroll wheel is nice and the L / R clicks are tactile and audible. The precision is good for everyday tasks, office work, and general use. I don't think I could recommend this mouse for gaming, but if you're reading reviews for this mouse, then chances are, you're not looking for a gaming mouse. 

I was able to pick this thing up for around $22 dollars when BestBuy had some sales going on. If you're thinking about it, then wait for the sales and get one. I actually got two. I got a silver/platinum one, and a sandstone (rose gold / pink) color for my girlfriend. They are great mice! I only wish I could have got one in burgundy to match my surface. It's okay, I'm still really satisfied.

Microsoft - Surface Mobile Mouse, complements the surface go, it is slim, light, and is easily paired, by Bluetooth connectivity.
 This mouse is constructed of plastic. It seems that the mouse wheel is constructed of metal. The mouse is priced fairly at $35. I Like its weight and slim profile. The Surface Mobile Mouse is a simple Mouse if you're looking for something more advanced/ gaming buttons look at a different mouse.

I have a Surface Go. It's thin. The AC adapter is thin. This mouse is thin. So, it's not as round as more conventional mice. I found that same grip I would use with conventional mice isn't ideal for this thin mouse. I like loosely holding the mouse and moving it with a combination of wrist and finger action. Some people might not like the thinness of this (wireless) mouse. I like it, and I got the same color as my keyboard.
Very well built. Easy to use. And the rechargeable remote is perfect!!
works great! fits my samsung galaxy s21 perfectly with a case on it!
Product works well as advertised.  Instructions are easy to follow.
Great quality, well built. Feels and works like a high end gadget.
I love my Joby tripod. Very durable for my camera and easy to use.
best all in one for the everyday use, im using it on a iphone 12

This mouse is fantastic.  I'm no Microsoft fanboi, but they did a great job designing and building this mouse.  I love the battery housing is magnetic and pivots open easily.  The mouse itself is also robust.  I dropped it from about 4ft up onto concrete, and it never missed a beat.  Surprisingly, it didn't even get a scratch.  If you want a basic mouse that works and feels great, this guy is well worth the investment.

My husband and I each gave the other this mouse as a stocking stuffer without knowing! His is silver, mine burgundy. I love the slim profile, its more like resting your hand on nothing. I like the blue tooth without needing an adapter in the USB port, but when the wi-fi is spotty, so is my mouse and I will go back to the keyboard. But if you have a strong steady internet connection, get one. They are very comfortable.

SO i purchased this mouse by mistake, but i can still use it for what I want so I have kept this mouse. This mouse is very thin.. I thought i was purchasing the non-mobile mouse version which is a bit bigger. I think if a person has larger hands, like i do, this mouse is probably not going to be for you.. it almost feels like your hand is flat on the table..

Other than my experience, it's a pretty decent mouse..

This mouse is great and was just what i was looking for. It connects virtually automatically to your computer - no more annoying dongles to deal with. It is also small with a low profile that doesn't take up the whole desk. If you have really big hands this might be a difficult mouse to use I think. Overall a great mouse and I love it so much more than what I had. So glad I bought it when I bought my new computer.
I love it just got back from a event and used it again and again
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how versatile this is and also how it feels in my hands.
Great ítem! I used it for our vacation and it worked marvelous!
Purchased this for my husband and I. Works great, no problems!

I picked up this mouse to go with my new Surface Go and wanted a bluetooth mouse instead of wireless as to have to use up a USB port for a dongle. I was surprised to find at BB there are only a few bluetooth mouse, and this is the cheapest one. The mouse works fine for business & mobile use, has a decent quality feel, but the mouse has a flat grip. This is fine but I tend to prefer a more arched/claw style.

I bought this mouse to use with my new Lenovo Thinkbook laptop. I had high hopes for the Bluetooth connection. But to be kind - it is erratic. The connection is automatic when the computer starts but often in a session the mouse will disconnect multiple times. I would return it but unfortunately, am past the return period.  I wish my experience mirrored others but it doesn't. I can't recommend this mouse.

The Microsoft Surface Mobile Mouse is compact and easy to use. Obviously works well with the Microsoft Surface laptop and my wife's HP ENVY 17 in. Connection is straightforward by holding the button underneath while having the Bluetooth on the laptop scan for nearby devices. Also very portable, especially since you don't need a dongle (unless of course your laptop does not have Bluetooth built-in.

Bought this mouse but couldn't get it to connect to ANY mac product. It says any computer with bluetooth 4, but every mac product i tried (5 different computers) it did not connect. Nice looking and a good feel but doesn't work for apple products.
excellent customer service and product is perfect for my needs
Nice I like this product it is easy to use the length is great
It is not real sturdy.  Its not long enough for most videoing
Works awesome! Recommend it! Can’t go wrong with this device.
The Joby tripod is well-built and works well. It is versatile
This product makes my YouTube video recording so much easier.

Ok product from Microsoft.
However, due to the design of the mouse being flat. It's not egromatic on the hand and wrist.  Hand gets tired real quick due to the the hand and wrist wants to craddle the mouse and causing strains.

Good side:  It connects through blue tooth and pretty much gets a mouse on any screen or device.  No need for the usb stub or for device that lacks a usb port.

This mouse is nothing special, but it gets the job done and it's cheap. It does mouse things. It's small and fits in a bag with ease. It's easy to pair, and it comes with batteries. The only thing to really say about it is that although MS says it doesn't work on glass, it totally does. I am using it on a glass table right now and have been doing so for the past two weeks.

I bought this mouse to use with my new surface. The Bluetooth connectivity of this mouse, the slick design and the smaller size makes it a great companion for my surface. I thought that the smaller size of this item was going to make it difficult for me to use for extended periods of time, but I was wrong, this mouse its very comfortable and perfect to use on the go.

When I first received this mouse I thought it might be too flat to be comfortable for extended use. However, I ended up liking the shape and I think it is very comfortable to use. The movement is smooth and the clicks are firm. I like that the mouse connects via Bluetooth automatically without the use of a dongle.
There color is more of an grey rather than silver.

Good! Microsoft’s newest, wireless productivity model, the Bluetooth Ergonomic Mouse, is a solid example of that simple workaday mouse. This good looking, comfortable input device has a few power user features, but it isn’t a power user’s mouse. For most people, though, the Bluetooth Ergonomic is more than enough, and a strong upgrade from cheap office mice.

I was looking for a mouse for my new Surface, but wasn't sure about this one, even though it was made for the Surface. It seemed too flat compared to previous mice I've used. However, it was on sale so I bought it. Turns out it is very comfortable to use and quite responsive as well. I'm very happy with my choice and would totally recommend this mouse.
Awesome purchase I love the the functionality and features a
excellent product, very useful and easy to manage, versatile
Its very easy to use , connect to Bluetooth very very simple
Good tripod, and good selfie stick. Plus it has the remote
just what I was looking for, and buying local means a lot.
except adjusting height which is difficult this is a plus

Got this to go with my Surface 4.  I've used the Microsoft Arch and other mouse but with the Arch, I would lose connection a lot but so far this has not been the case with the Mobile Mouse.  There is a slight arch which makes it more comfortable than a different flat mouse I had first.  It is sleek and doesn't take up much space in my travel bag.

Microsoft products have good quality but are often overpriced.  This mobile surface mouse kept the good quality tradition but was at similar prices with similar products.
The great thing about surface mouse and keyboard is that they don't require special connector or USB devices.  Without sacrificing on quality, they use the regular Bluetooth.

I was hesitant to get this bluetooth mouse at first because it doesn't have the forward/back buttons on the side which I am accustomed to, but it is a decent laptop mouse.  It's not bulky which fits nicely on your work briefcase.  Pairing is easy with Windows 10.  The OS recognized it quickly without having to open up the bluetooth settings.

After using my Surface with just the keyboard for a while I realized that I really wanted a mouse.  This one isn't the fancy curvy one, but it's functional, good on battery power, works on most surfaces (I have a glass top on my office desk and it didn't work on that, but I don't think anything would), and I've appreciated having it around.
Great telepod. Use to record my workouts and dance videos
Excelent product. Could been a. Better grip. Over all ok.
Joby - Telepod Mobile is a good buy and works very well.

Loved the feel of the mouse. Felt great to use. Very natural. In order to save battery the mouse would ‘power off’ rather quickly and often. So, when you started to use it again you had to shake it for several seconds before it would wake back up. Very, very annoying. It’s for this reason I gave up on it and went to a cheaper wired mouse.

Not sure why this mouse has such a high rating. The scroll wheel failed on mine after two months of use and it's a common problem amongst friends. The only plus is its Bluetooth. 
Buy something else. A side note, I also found the Bluetooth would fail and I'd have to reconnect the mouse to my surface even though it said it was connected.

OMG! Once I removed the little plastic at the back of the mouse, my laptop surface already detected the mouse and all I needed to do was to follow the steps. It was installed in seconds! The mouse is very light and comfortable to use. I did not give 5 starts because the color is light grey, not the platinum advertised in the picture.

Bought this to go with a Surface pro my son got for Christmas. Very responsive, fits the hand well, but chews through batteries pretty quickly. A rechargeable option would be better.

Recommended if you need it to stay within the Microsoft hierarchy. If it doesn't have to be Microsoft there are a thousand better mice available.

Perfect travel mouse for my briefcase. It is very thin and not bulky so it fits great in my briefcase for when I travel or find myself working at a coffee shop/etc. The Bluetooth is fast and responsive. Overall, this is my favorite wireless mouse that I own. It is well built and has no trouble being tossed around in a work bag.

This is the best mouse I ever used. I haven't experienced any problems with it. I wish the mouse was taller in height because since it is slim, your hand position will feel weird. You will get use to it after a while. Besides that, you can download this program by Microsoft that allows you to edit the mouse. This is a must buy!

I was not pleased with the scrolling on the arc mouse, so I tried this one.  It's overall good.  Feels pretty good in my hand, scrolls normally, connects without issue to my Surface.  Although the profile is not as minimal as the arc mouse, it is small enough to travel with while at the same time not being too small to use.

I bought this for my business. Due to Covid19, we had to get creative with our real estate business. I’ve used my Joby Telepod for virtual open houses, FaceTime with relocation clients, etc. it’s very easy to use.

Nice little selfie stick, and tripod for your phone, webcam, or anything that can be screwed into a tripod. And it comes with a Bluetooth remote so you can take pictures or start videos without touching the phone.

Not really what I hoped for, the ball mount does not hold my iPhone X well, there is little strength and does not hold for long. It looks like it is built well but maybe I got a bad one. May go a different route.

I use a Samsung galaxy s20 ultra and moving around the top gives a little. Scares me with 1500$ phone. With my gopro and other camera phones worked good..

Cons _battery or remote action button dead on arrival.
Versatile tripod that has the features I was looking for. The main issue with it is that it is a little unstable in some configurations - some components are plastic and use a twist to lock in place.
Love this tripod.  Compact, light weight, easy to stick into my bag, great for getting selfies of a group, use it it my kayak to take pictures & videos of scenery & animals.  Well worth the purchase.
Excellent quality, I don’t use the button because I haven’t had the need.  I’ve used with my iPhone Pro 11 and taken the phone piece off, screwed on a GoPro plate and used it with a Hero 9 as well.
Very user friendly. The only one thing that could be improved in my opinion would be the way that the button connects to the handle. It tends to pop out a little too easy. I still give it 5 stars.

This is a phone tripod and a selfie stick.  The phone may only be put in the horizontal position, fyi.  

It also comes with a remote so you can start/stop video recordings and snap the photo.
I purchased this to use with iPhone 10, it wasn’t very stable and never could get it to lock into the correct position, the remote clicker was slow to reconnect to the iPhone, I returned it.
Yes, it’s a selfie stick, with remote, but it’s also a tripod, so you can set it up for Zoom calls. It’s light but solid, easy to use, and compact. I’m surprised how much I like it.
Excellent choice. I am enjoying this item because my family and I take a lot of photos together. This item helps to get everyone in the picture. I can now enjoy better selfies too.
I bought this to give for Christmas gift. I looked everywhere to get a selfie stick and was excited to find it. It can be used as a tripod also, but I wanted a selfie primarily.
Would not recommend this product. It does not safety and easily hold your phone in place and thus the phone drops out. Another useless item I just added to my junk drawer

High priced..
The stick seems “flimsy” and not as solid  as I first thought.
Not a good grip for a large iPhone, and it is hard to lock in place.
The concept is good..
Very easy used this one , My wife love it ...  only two people hard get picture ... set up and remote lick ... got it !!  that we look for that one ... thank you ...
Great for families.  We used this on a recent trip and it worked great.  We especially liked being able to set up the small tripod and take pictures at dinner, etc.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The stick is not practicle because the phone holder is very weak and the Bluetooth bottom came out easily, I lost mine the first time I used, do not buy this stick
Was a bit of a hassle getting the app. and remote control to work, but eventually I did. It works fine, though it is not meant to be a top of the line product.
It looked like it had everything I would want but when I received it I had a hard time figuring out how to use it. I recommend it for highly technical people.

Love this selfie stick. Cool remote and the tri pod takes your selfie game to the next level. Great buy.
 Picture was taken on top of a mountain in Albania. A

Ideal to hold an iPhone, and it can work as a monopod or a tripod.
The remote bluetooth button works fine too. Overall quite happy with it. Recommended.
Good tripod stand for your mobile device. A little bit expensive though. Have not used it much so I don't have any feedback yet on the quality.
I love my selfie stick. I used it on my girl’s trip at the beach. I love that you can use it as a tripod as well! A must have for this summer.
It is a very good concept; however, the extension could be a little more solid.  It struggled a little bit with the weight of the IPhone 6.
Well built. Able to take great selfies, record or take pictures hands free.

Preface: I've bought cheaper versions of this tripod. Some remotes didn't work after the initial set up. Some tripods were flimsy. Some were unsteady. 

Which led me to shelling out the cost for this Joby telepod mobile tripod. I've used it through the Christmas festivities and it provided that extra hand to take group pictures. 

Pro: I like how compact it is, in that it fits in my small purse. The selfie stick is comfortable in the hand. I like how easy it is to use. I like the 3 legs, it's quite stable, especially on cobble stone paths. 

Con: Slight con, the telescope lock isn't so obvious, so it takes a few tries to lock them. 

Other than  the slight con, I am very satisfied with this tripod and I can't wait to use it during my solo travels.

I needed a Tripod for my Recopoint Pop 1 3D scanner. The scanner was supposed to have one but it was missing from the box. Revopoint did promptly credit me for it.

This Tripod is a very sturdy construction with a telescopic center pole. There is some type of Remote Control included. I think it is a remote camera trip for some phones. Construction is very good and proper materials were used to make a quality piece of equipment.

It does have a phone holder but I bought another version with threaded fastener on bottom and top so I could stack the 3D Scanner on top.
Love my tripod. It's compact and sturdiness is surprisingly tough. Love the Bluetooth picture taker.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Most worst product , never was able to use more than once.
1) The Bluetooth Device disconnects on every click.
2) On Iphone 13-Pro the holder simply loses it's grip.
4) The position of the holding grip is very wrongly placed, it is interfering with the iPhone SOS call activation mode automatically.
5) Worst, worst, worst my entire vacation got spoiled and i missed the chance of capturing  moments. 
DO NOT TAKE EVEN IF SOMEONE GIVES YOU FREE **********************

The selfio stick is nice. But the Bluetooth button on the other hand is horribly executed. You go to set it up on your phone only for it to stay connected for a few seconds. An then it disconnects. I can't even manage to try and take a selfie to see if the thing works properly due to it always shutting off. Fix the Bluetooth connectivity issues and this product should work. Take it off the shelves so no one else has to pay this much and be just as disappointed.

Feels great, works great, worth every penny.  

I added an attachment for my GoPro and bought a more solid feeling cell phone clamp because the iPhone 13 Pro is a big phone and didn't feel secure with the included device clamp.

Now the bad news - the remote does not attach very well and you will lose it the first time you leave the house unless it is in your pocket.  I had to order a replacement remote from the manufacturer - I've been waiting for three weeks.

My purpose was for holding my cell phone for table top recording and while moving around, so I need the cell phone holder to be secure, but not  pinch me upon removal of the phone.  I have not done a full recording of something for YouTube yet, but I have high expectations.   The only awkward thing is the leg extensions each  twist to lock/unlock but they do so with only a very small turn, so it is a little tricky to get used to,

Took a little to figure out the whole remote and hooking it up to my phone, but we got it to work. As always we tried figuring it out when we needed it, not ahead of time. The reason for the 4 stars instead of the 5 is because it's not really a plug and play thing. Also the remote is easily knocked off its holder. I wound up carrying the remote the whole time. 
Download the app, and try it out before you need to.

36 years old, so I thought I was over the selfie stick crap from the millennials.   However, the GF and I went to Disney in Nov, and the other couple had one.   OMG.  What have we been missing.

Our photos came out so much better with the stick.

So we had to get one.

This one is great because it functions with the tripod and remote as well.  Christmas cards were a breeze....highly recommend

Paired easily. It’s very light and stores compactly for all its varied positions. iPhone loads into the holder with greater ease than any I’ve had before. Tension is just right for a light duty tripod. I wouldn’t expect it to be steady in any wind but otherwise the build is good. The detachable remote is very handy away from the tripod and out of the way when attached. I’m happy.

This selfie stick is awkward. The capture button comes off- which I guess is a good idea if you want to use it as a tripod. However, if you’re trying to use it as a selfie stick, the button comes off the stick very easily. 
We went to Yosemite-tried to use this for the amazing views there, but it kept disconnecting from my Bluetooth in my phone. Quite disappointing for the cost.

Difficult to find a good retractable iPhone holder/stand but the Joby TelePod (Model: JB01550) does the job. I needed something quick and found, for the price, it is a good value: lightweight and sturdy. I do recommend that if using as a stand, attach it to a 2.5 lb or more shot bag to prevent a strong wind from knocking it over. Currently, I use the JOBY TelePod to hold my Logitech - 4K Pro 4096 x 2160 Webcam (also purchased at Best Buy). As for the remote it does NOT stay attached to the handle at all, so I highly recommend you get a separate keychain ring and make it detachable. That way you can put in your pocket for remote picture and or video control. The holder clip for the phone is a pressure clamp and is okay. Not great and definitely not action shooting grade. If you want something for that, I recommend getting a Bower WA-TM100 360° Rotating Smartphone Tripod Mount – always good to have in your gear bag.

This is junk. It's slightly ironic that anyone could see different because it's designed to hold a $1k device. I wouldn't try to hold a $1 device with this. The gripping mechanism is extremely cheap and low quality. The "telescoping" rod retracts under the slightest pressure. I should have bought the $25 one if I wanted something this cut-rate and pathetic.

I think you should write a review when you are sure it is a genuine review. I bought it almost 2 years back and today while checking my old orders I found it. Thought of giving my feedback. It is the best product I ever bought. Bluetooth is still working perfectly fine, the battery is still in good shape. If you need a selfie stick, go for it.

Super fun dual use selfie stick - tripod w- remote
The cell phone holder that comes with it is only good for smaller lighter phones, recommend getting the heavy duty one with a lock from the same manufacturer - Doesn’t work with iphone 12 max pro in tripod mode - phone is too heavy, with lighter iPhone’s like iphone 12 and older no worries

I like the design but the phone holder is great, if you don't have a phone case on your phone, I find it strange these companies think people don't have a phone case. With a case on your phone, holder is not trustworthy. I like the rest of the product and I just replaced the phone holder part with a better holder.

I admittedly have not read the directions yet and tried to use it immediately. Connects to Bluetooth much better than my piece of junk dollar store selfie stick. I fear I will lose the attached button, it doesn't stay on the handle perfectly. I like that it doesn't need charging. I like that it's also a stand.

I purchased this stand to hold my phone while I stream opening packs of trading cards on stream for my friends, and yes, before you ask, I was super popular in high school and could do a push up. The stand works great, by the way. No shaking, holds the phone tight, and is easy to store!

This tripod does exactly as advertised, and holds my camera perfectly so I can take videos of myself because I look so great on camera. If you want to look as good as I (impossible) then I highly suggest you buy this. But make sure you get it from BestBuy.

I had to order this for my trip to NYC with the family. It was the perfect size to fit in my bag and was pretty easy to use. The only issue I had was the docking area gets lose with movement so be careful not to drop your phone while out of the case.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the quality of the Tripod! The bluetooth handheld button is a great addition to the product. Although, since I do have the IPhone 14 Pro Max the tripod tends to lean/tip over if my phone isn't in a leveled position. Great product overall!

I like it because it isn't flimsy as the other selfie sticks. However, it changes the setting to video instead of taking a picture. I would still recommend on buying it because it is durable and secures ur phone, it doesn't fall off.

Works well and is a compact carry.    Why only 3 bars?   To reliably connect to my iPhone, I have to "forget" this device in Bluetooth and repair each time.    Also, it really needs to be a little longer (at least for me).

The remote connect does not work. 
The screw tab will not stay tight. 
It's very precarious to put your phone there. 
I don't use it and Best Buy will not let me return it. 
I'm going to look for something that works.  :-(
Very easy set up and use, for both the tripod and the wireless button. Definitely recommend.
not bad the wing tip got broken but warranty was easy to replace by contacting manufacturers
It wasn't as easy to use as I hoped it would be.  Difficult to secure in a locked position.
This product was kind of what I had been looking for and now I’ve got it I’m a happy camper
Doesn’t hold well the cellphone after a while. Not worth the value. Can’t work if using FB

I had high hopes because it looked nicely designed and was compact. When I got the tripod, I was impressed by its clever design. You twist the telescoping shaft to unlock/lock it in position. I thought that was fun and a nice way to remove another knob.

However, when I went to use this thing, any adjustment of the phone inevitably unlocked the telescope and the tripod would go limp in my hand as it became completely unsupported.

The ball lock was also not strong enough to hold cell phone. Once direction of rotation would just start to un-thread the phone mount and the phone would crash down very quickly. The other direction, the phone position would creep downward, changing the shot. Trying to put the camera back would then inevitably unlock the extension.

Additionally, the manufacturing quality was not very good. All three legs opened up to different angles. This means the center shaft was always a few degrees off of vertical. I'm not sure this actually affected functionality, but it made it look bad. That's something I could forgive on a $30 product, but not a $65 one.

Yes, I am returning this. It was a clever idea that just was not executed well.
We wanted to get a selfie stick for a trip we were taking.  This also doubles as a tripod, so get a bit more use out of it.

I bought this to use with my Mac. The Bluetooth connection is reliable and the click action feels good. I wish the mouse were a little taller to better fit my large hands, however that isn’t a major issue for me.

Bought as bundle for high school student. Mouse compliments surface tablet. Easy to use. Easy connection to surface was great. Feel, comfort and reliable. Definitely recommend buying with any surface tablet.

Opened the box next to my surface computer and it immediately connected, I was so impressed. Been using it about 2 weeks now no problems. Love the colour and the sleek style. Highly recommend this product.

This mouse works well, and its compact size makes it very easy to bring along in your pocket or purse, and it works well with or without a mouse pad. It was also effortless to set up with my Surface Pro 7.

Had a USB base mouse and the USB port kept breaking forcing me to buy another mouse. So I went Bluetooth route! Much better and great feel and design! It’s a must have for people using computers everyday!

Very easy to navigate, very user-friendly, I had misplaced my mouse that came with my Surface Pro 3 years ago - so I was happy the same slim model was still available. I like the Ice Blue color vs Black!

I love the color and how sleek it is. Never paired a mouse so easily before, took it out of the box and the computer instantly found it and asked if I wanted to pair and immediately it was ready to use.
Nice simple, cheap mouse. Perfect for the casual use when on the go. Doesn't have back/forward buttons and not quite ergonomic, but it does the job. Good for a secondary pointing device for laptops.
I like to have a mouse when working on my Surface tablet although it isn't necessary. It is probably a habit for me, but one that makes my work more seamless. This was easy to sink and works well.
The Microsoft surface mouse works well with our surface pro 7. It was easy to set up and use. It is sleek enough to pack in our travel bag yet easy to find when we are ready to surf the internet.
Wireless mouse is easy to use and works well enough. The style is a bit "clunky" and not so form fitting to the hand (it sits a little flat in the hand). Great price and serves it's purpose.
Honestly retail price this isn’t worth it, quality is nice but doesn’t fit my hand all that well, use it for my tablet as it is more portable than others but more uncomfortable as a result
Slick and responsive; compact and connects seamlessly via Bluetooth; fantastic work mouse to use for reasonable duration. Not the most ergonomic but in general a solid basic mouse.

Small and very portable mouse. It will track on almost ANY surface. It is actually quite impressive how well the blue laser they implemented works. My drawback with the mouse is comfort. With the flat design it is not optimal for any long duration of time. I’ve began using this as a accessory for my tablets and the occasional connection to my headless server.
Very sleek and easy to navigate. The speed is on point. The Bluetooth connection was instant. Highly recommend

This is a very nice low-profile mouse. I thought that I wouldn't like it because of me being used to using a medium to larger sized palm-style mice, but I've adapted to it. Despite the saying Surface, I just use this with a regular laptop.

I got this for work because wouldn't you know it, in an effort to make laptops smaller and smaller, they keep removing useful things like extra ports. I was using a hub for my other keyboard and mouse (and other peripherals), but discovered that it would occasionally causes stutters as there was too much activity going through all the ports.

This mouse uses Bluetooth which frees up a port for license dongles (which won't work though a USB hub). There is no lag whatsoever for regular office use. The battery life is rather good. I use rechargeable batteries and have only needed to replace them once over the duration of my nearly 1.5 years of owning and using this mouse. You can also see the estimated battery life on your computer if you need to find it in the Bluetooth & other devices control panel. It'll also warn you when it is getting low so you don't unexpectedly have it die on you. I just checked it again and I'm at 60% still.

The only con to this mouse is that it doesn't have a back/forward button, but it is not a deal-breaker.

Perfect size - small enough to be very lightweight and portable, but large enough you don't feel like your hand will cramp because you have to bunch up your fingers to hold on to it properly.  Great blue tooth connection, very smooth, and can be used on most surfaces.  Obviously, for best results use it on a mouse pad or a hard, flat surface (unless that hard, flat surface is a hot stove top). However, if you're feeling lazy in bed or on the couch without a mouse pad, I've had mine successfully work on blankets and arm rests.  As long as you're not trying to run it over water or ragged rocks or anything like that...but hopefully you're not using a laptop in those conditions anyway.

Got these on sale as a BOGO deal.  Nicely constructed mouse and compact for travel.  Battery life also seems top notch.  Looks great!

What I didn't like but not enough return them is the lack of palm support.  This thing is relatively flat and take time to get used to as someone who love the big gaming mice.  These are relegated to the travel bag and used only on the road - I can't imagine using this a full time mouse at home or the office as there are much better ergonomic choices out there.

Functionally, it can handle all the surfaces I used it on and cannot complain about the BOGO price.
Great clicking and touch. Smooth and very responsive to the touch. Great for travel and or desktop usability.

I got this mouse for my MacBook as it's one of the cheaper bluetooth mouse that I can fine which resembles the look of an Apple Magic Mouse.  Of course it doesn't have all the gesture supports of a Magic Mouse, but it works well and tracks well with most desktop surfaces that I've used on.  My main complaint though is that similar to the Magic Mouse, this mouse is too flat and it doesn't feel comfortable on your hand for extended use.  But it does fit very well in a slim laptop sleeve that I use for holding my MacBook, if that's something that matters to you.

Sweet little lightweight Bluetooth mouse.  It takes up basically no room in my bag, and is relatively comfortable for such a tiny thing.  I'm really happy to not have to deal with the USB dongle my last wireless mouse used.  Seems to be very happy under Windows 10, but I've not attempted to use it with anything else yet.  If it doesn't behave with Linux or a Mac, I'll come back and dock it a star or two.  I bought the red one at the same time, so switching out based on mood...  (Microsoft had a promo that made 2 mice $30 instead of $35 each.)

Like most hardware that bears the Surface name, Microsoft did all the little things right. The bluetooth pairing for this mouse is fast and reliable; Windows 10 recognized the mouse right away. The aluminum mouse wheel feels great. The mouse itself is lightweight but feels substantial. The battery compartment cover, attached magnetically, is novel. Finally, I've used this mouse on a variety of surfaces (tabletops, counters...) and the lazer eye is accurate on all of them. For $35, you get a simple, well-built mouse that feels built to last.

Love this mouse. At first I was nervous about there being some slight lag due to its Bluetooth only connection. I’ve had previous poor experiences with Bluetooth only mice but this one is amazingly accurate. Just like any other wireless mouse that would otherwise require a dongle. Bought it for my Surface and cot this color to match the laptop itself. It felt a bit shallow and thin at first but that was something I quickly got used to. Highly recommend if in the market for a Bluetooth mouse.

Bought this and a surface pen after buying the Surface Go 2. I really like the mouse it is responsive and travels well doesn't take up much space.  Paired to my surface go almost instantly out of the box. 

Being as thin as it is it does hold a little odd compared to a normal mouse. But I really like it would definitely buy again.  If I had to only choose one thes or the pen I would choose this. Only thing I wish it had a way to turn it off when not in use but that isn't that big of a deal.

This mobile mouse works. It is a convenient small package that is good for bringing on trips when you want to cut down on your volume of stuff. But, it is almost uncomfortably too small. My hand wants to grip something more substantial, it just does not stick up high enough for great comfort.. I can live with it if for awhile. I will probably get something else for those times when I will be spending significant time requiring a mouse.

The feel of this mouse is very pleasing. The movement is smooth. The left and right click are precise. The scrolling wheel is great. The only thing I had to get used to was the low arch profile. My hp mouse that I've been using with my desktop for years is so much thicker, higher profile, so with this mouse, it's a big change. It's more on the flat side.

I love the feel and performance on the surface mouse. The problem is that they stop working after about 12 months.  I  hsve gone through a few with only moderate use with a laptop which is not my primary computer.   If Microsoft fixes the quality issues I would buy again for now, they are too exoense to fail so quickly.  I love but can't recommend.

This is my third Microsoft mouse, and I love the design and functionality. It's amazing not having to use one of the few USB ports on my laptop since it's Bluetooth and works perfectly. The design and color are very contemporary and matches my lifestyle. I definitely recommend, not just because of that but also for the fair price.

The Microsoft Surface Mobile Mouse is a really nice addition to any portable setup. It is slim and lightweight making it nice to add in a pocket or bag to take with you for your laptop or tablet as it easily connects via Bluetooth without needing to worry about wires. The battery life seems to be great too so far as well.

i like the mouse it doesn't take alot to set it up once you turn on bluetooth on the laptop and then press the button on the bottom of the mouse it connects it's easy to use and the scroll wheel works great.
