I had the surface mouse that flattens out. The theory of that was a great idea but never felt like a real “mouse” in your hand. I love this being Bluetooth so I don’t have to plug in a usb. It connects every time. It’s slim for travel but feels good in the hand. Solid quality. I do believe the price is too much though.

Perfect mouse for my Surface Go Laptop. It glides effortlessly and can be used with either hand.  I love that it's wireless and has no dongle to have to put into the computer.  I only gave 4 stars, because it unfortunately doesn't have an on/off switch and it isn't an exact color match to my Ice Blue computer.

I bought 2 of these mice - and found both of them defective within 2 months.  I that that they would be better mice than others - because they automatically and (seamlessyly) connected with my Surface Pro.  But after 2 months - they refused to connect or by recognized by the laptop.  Very disappointed.

I found it extremely easy to connect to my laptop via Bluetooth. I was able to begin using the mouse as soon as possible. I also am very pleased with the style. I also found it easy to pack into my low profile carrying case. I highly recommend this product. I am not being paid for this review

I don't care for this mouse. While I love it for the Bluetooth, I couldn't get used to the size. It is too small for my hand and actually caused a bit of hand pain trying to get used to it (which I couldn't do). I cut my losses and bought a wireless USB mouse that fits my hand much better.

I was looking for a mouse that would provide versatility and freedom of use while traveling for work, and this one did just that. 
The size is perfect, and doesn’t take away from it’s  usefulness, and the fact that you can connect to any laptop/pc, without the use of a USB, is a huge plus!

The mouse WAS working great when I bought this last month but it stopped connecting to my laptop last night. I'm past my return date and now I'm stuck with a mouse that won't even connect. I tried to connect it to other computers to see if it would work but it won't even connect to those.

This mouse is sleek and easy to use.  It was easy to setup and I also use this with my work computer (which isn't a surface computer) in addition to my home computer.  I like that it's offered in an assortment of colors.  It has a long battery life (I use it daily with 2 computers).

Color me impressed. I have both the Surface Mobile and Arc mice, and I have to say that I like this mouse much better. Easy to set up and use.

Excellent product with very long battery life. Have 4 of these around the house in every room and every office. Very ergonomic for my needed

I bought this mouse to use with my Microsoft Surface Laptop. I liked how easily it connected via Bluetooth. Its very easy to use.

Another great Microsoft product. Love this mouse and the available range of colors. Very lightweight and fits my hand well

The mouse I received was the perfect color to match my laptop. The fact it was free with purchase was the cherry on top.
Works super well with my surface pro. Very good purchase. I bundled it with my surface pro and got it at a better price.
Smooth and great function, great product watch out Apple. This mouse has a seem less design dare I say professional use.

I have a tablet that I don't like the finger pad on. I originally went to BB to purchase a usb mouse, and thankfully the BB rep showed me the Bluetooth mouse options. It made sense to try this route so as to keep the 1 usb port on my tablet free. I purchased this Microsoft Bluetooth mouse along with another name brand Bluetooth mouse that had similar reviews to the Microsoft one. They were both on sale for around the same price, but the original price of the other one was higher. I figured I would try both out and return the one I didn't like as much. I tried the Microsoft one first because I thought I would like it better based on the smaller size, 4-way scroll option, only needing 1 battery (compared to the other one needing 2), overall design, and a few other reasons. I was right. Everything worked so well, that I didn't even try out the other mouse. The Microsoft mouse is lightweight but doesn't seem "cheap" to me. It responds perfectly and linked up flawlessly with the Bluetooth settings on my tablet. It also comes with a much longer warranty (either 3 or 4 years, but I can't remember) than the other brand, which only had 1 year. Great price. Great product. Hope this helps. Thanks. Matthew 7:12

Nothing to connect to the laptop or computer.  Completely wireless and bluetooth enabled.  Very easy to install and use right away.  Its the best mouse I have had in years so far.  Thank you.
If you absolutely need to use a mouse on a laptop, this one's for you. Small, but works well by my meaty hands, and perfectly portable. Only negative is a little bawky on very rough surfaces.
I've tried several different Bluetooth mice and found that this Microsoft one seems to be the most reliable. Always connects, provides good tracking, has long battery life, and just works!

This is my second mouse. Lost the first one, but it is great size and very responsive. The battery life is outstanding and it is very compact for travel. Just gotta remember to pack it up when I'm finished. Totally recommend it.

It works and does what it supposed to do. Just make sure before it’s purchased, that the Bluetooth requirements are met. Meaning, if your Bluetooth on your computer only supports 3.0, and the mouse is 4.0. It will not connect!

It’s Bluetooth, so it’s nice not to worry about losing the wireless adapter. It’s small, really really small, so it’ll feel weird at first. It doesn’t have back or forward buttons, which I’m starting to miss the more I use it.

I really like this mouse from Microsoft. Feels great in my hand. Not too small not too large. I like that it is Bluetooth connective too. I bought this one for my laptop but I already own one for my PC. 
For me it’s perfect.

I absolutely love this mouse. Was looking for a Bluetooth mouse I could use since I only have two USB ports. This works wonderfully, works as soon as I turn it on every time. It’s very smooth and the scroll wheel is great.

Great little wireless Bluetooth mouse. I use it with a MacBook Air and it works with no problems. Bluetooth finds and connects without issue and I haven't found myself having to refresh or search for it in Bluetooth menus.

Got a mouse before this one from another online store and it glitched so bad! This one was so affordable but really great quality and it’s Bluetooth so I didn’t have to worry about a cord. Makes work from home super easy.

Two out of three of this style mouse have worked extremely well, the 3rd one is having trouble connecting to my computer, which may be the computer, not the mouse.  I have been very pleased with previous similar models.

Set up and connection to the laptop's bluetooth was very easy.  Scroll wheel response is very good.
The Bluetooth function is very helpful since the laptop only has 2 USB ports.  This keeps them open for other needs.

Delicious click action on the mouse buttons, Microsoft are the masters of mouse design .......Brilliant all around mouse.

Fits perfectly in the hand, settled on this one after buying and returning 3 other mice !!!

Works as advertised.

Works perfectly with both P/C and Android devices.

Also works with MAC (driver download maybe required for older MAC's)

You need to put your phone on the wireless charger for longer usages.

Only have one USB port on my Surface Pro 4. Wondered it there was such a thing as a blue tooth mouse and found this. Alway liked the MS mice and this one has been awesome. Connects every time nice portable size.

Good size for a use with a laptop but the curvature of the mouse does not fit my hand very well. The connection breaks for a few seconds occasionally, so that’s a little annoying. Otherwise the mouse works great

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I attached this mouse to my surface, needed it on another laptop as well. Once i attached it to the other laptop it no longer worked with my Surface. You should be able to use your mouse on more than one laptop

I only buy Microsoft mice after some bad experiences with Logitech and off-name ones. This is the first bluetooth mouse I have had - works great - as quick and responsive as wired or USB mice. I am very happy.

Mouse performs well and as expected. No problem connecting it to the computer. If used for long period of time it would not be the most comfortable but good for a laptop used for traveling because it is small.

Mouse performs as expected. It was easy to install. Personal preference is a mouse over touch pad in some cases so this was exactly what I needed. Lower cost than some other options and does everything I need.

Works well for the price payed. I think buying a mouse is all about personal preference. They all pretty much work well. Just find one that fits your hand and your preference on Bluetooth or USB connectivity.

Purchased to replace my old dongle $15 mouse. The clicks and scrolls are more satisfying. Defiantly and upgrade and I don’t have to worry about breaking the dongle when I load my laptop into its pelican case.

I love using a Bluetooth mouse because it keeps a USB port open that would otherwise be used by a receiver dongle. This mouse is responsive, comfortable, and has good battery life, so I'm quite happy with it.

This mouse is the best wireless mouse I’ve ever used. Bluetooth connects quickly, it works on multiple surfaces and the 4 way scroll is awesome. Only thing is I wish it would also have a usb wireless option.

I purchase this microsoft 3600 bluetooth mouse for my surface pro 4, and I think it is very easy to set up the bluetooth and work find on my surface. This mouse has light weight and the battery life is good.

I purchased the Microsoft Bluetooth 3600 to use with my Surface notebook. I connected using the Bluetooth option on my surface and have no issues using it for the past 4 + weeks. Great Mouse for the price!.

This is my first wireless Bluetooth mouse and I have to say that I think I would rather go back to the old computer mice ( wired and wireless) this one is constantly losing communication with the computer.

It is easy to use because it fits my cupped hand easily. It is also seems easier to use than a wireless mouse. I like that there are no wires to deal with making it easier to use when traveling or at home.

I needed a Bluetooth mouse. This one seemed to do the trick. I associated it with the compute stick I am using it with OK. The biggest problem is that it rapidly goes to sleep and is hard to reawaken...very inconvenient in the midst of a presentation.

First came mice with physical roller balls. Then optical. Now this. No wires. Syncs easily. Still on original battery. The only possible drawback is that you can lose your mouse without a cord attached. 
Solid construction with elegant simple design.

using it with the bluetooth usb dongle i purchased and I find it a little laggy but usable in both windows and linux. not sure if its the dongle or the mouse. havent tried it on a built in bluetooth laptop yet hopefully it will be more responsive..

For those without a spare USB port or who don't want to deal with the dongles, this Microsoft mouse works great via Bluetooth for only a few dollars more than the cheaper ones that require dongles. It is compact in size and works on most surfaces.

Just bought this mouse and I cannot pair it to my MacBook Pro (2010) running OS X El Capitan. I have had other Microsoft mouse work with my laptop, but this one just won't show up in my bluetooth menu. I will unfortunately have to return this.

I have been fond of using the Microsoft mouse ever since I can remember. This Bluetooth mouse is no different. It is comfortable and reliable. I really like that it has a power button so I can conserve the battery when I'm not using the mouse.

My Microsoft wireless optical mouse died and I decided to purchase the Microsoft Bluetooth Mobile 3600. It paired perfectly with my HP Envy laptop. Price was great as well. With Bluetooth I have one more USB port open now, a definite win-win!

I use this with the Lenovo Flex 3 (reviewed also) as my "portable office" for routine Word, Excel, email work. The mouse installed easily on Bluetooth, is sensitive & precise, auto-on is unobtrusive and preserves the battery. 
No complaints.

I'm one of those throwbacks who hates laptop trackpads and almost always uses a mouse. This one works fine, just as advertised, without a lot of superfluous gadgetry. The best part is it is smaller than normal and thus more easily portable.

This was a great purchase since it was Bluetooth and easy to navigate with computer. However, you have to figure out on your own how to sink it to your computer which was the most difficult part and why I gave that part of the review a 4/5.

Does what it's supposed to do most of the time. Every so often it loses its bluetooth connection and I need to restart my PC. I would suspect my PC, however, I don't have this issue when I dock into my office desk and use another BT Mouse.

I'm sure there are too many other mouse available out there...but not sure about be so cheap and worthwhile!
It's nice, small and affordable... and IT'S WORKS!
Just be care about to have new systems, it requires BT4 and works on Win8+

I wanted to get a bluetooth mouse so I could save my USB ports for my flash drives instead of using one for an adapter for a wireless mouse. This mouse connected right away without any issues and it uses only one battery which is good.

Not too many well-priced bluetooth mouse options but this is definitely a good one. Bought with sp4 I got my wife last Christmas and it works great and feels great. My dad loved it and it's automatic connection and he purchased one too

The scroll wheel is a bit too choppy for my preferences, and the left click sometimes has to be clicked again. Otherwise, it's wireless, optical and fits my hand nicely. It's also a tad heavier than my previous mouse, but I like that.

Using this with a new MS Surface Pro 4, and it frequently drops the connection (within 4 inches of the keyboard). It is okay for a once and a while tool, but I wouldn't recommend it for your everyday pointing device. Very frustrating!

No wires, no dongle...  I purchased this bluetooth mouse with a laptop I set-up for my dad.  He had a habit of loosing the dongle for other wireless mice, so I thought I'd try a bluetooth mouse this time.  It's working well so far...

Item seems to drop out of connection with the laptop occasionally. This could be a Microsoft problem in Windows 10. After research i saw others were experiencing this. But if you have no ports then this is the only way of connecting.

Like that it's bluetooth so frees up a USB port. It connects easily, stays connected, works smoothly and accurately. Can't vouch for battery life, yet, but it's been a week and still going strong with average daily use of 2-3 hours.

The mouse is smooth and works every time. Bluetooth technology is better than the 2.4ghz receivers because you don't take up valuable USB slots and it has the word "tooth" in it so you know that 9 out 10 dentists will recommend it.

Picked this mouse up to go along with my new Microsoft Surface Pro and it certainly fits the bill. Connects real easy, and feels comfortable in hand (similar to Logitech mice). It even comes with a battery right out of the package.

I required a bluetooth mouse because I kept losing the usb wifi dongles for the traditional wifi mouses. The price and quality of this mouse were great. The setup was easy with our Windows 10 and macOS devices and works very well.

I prefer a Bluetooth mouse of a wireless mouse. This connects to the Bluetooth on my laptop very quickly. I don't have a use a USB receiver which is convenient. The connection is strong even with a little distance from my laptop.

This is a good mouse for the money.  The downside is that there is no on or off button. This is just a waste of battery and annoying when I just want to use the computer mouse pad but I hit this by accident,  Needs an off button.

I have purchased Mice from $4 to $140 and this one serves me well for my laptop. Professional mouse was not necessary but this is a good product with great battery life and no Bluetooth issues. It is a great size and lightweight

Needed smaller mouse for on the go that could store in laptop bag with surface pro - used to use the surface version because it could lie flat but in use it wasn’t as ergonomic as would like it to be. This smaller mouse fits the bill for fitting my palm and ease of use and carrying around.

Really easy to connect not exceedingly loud, but then again for the price is perfect for speakers on a budget. Yes if you buy a $200 pair of speakers they would be considerably louder but then again when you are thinking about a $20 pair these a great Bluetooth set for the money you spend.

I bought this for my wife to replace our other favorite MS mouse. I like that it is BT and very portable. However, it isn't the most comfortable for my medium-sized male hands. She doesn't use it much either. It works, just isn't that comfortable for us. I'd still recommend it though.

So I paried this with my Asus Laptop running windows 10 and its the first time since windows xp i've experienced mouse lag...its werid, likely something to do with a bad connection. Comes in handy in a pinch though, and works pretty well on android so I'll bump it to 2 stars.

Needed a mouse to use with my laptop while working from home and traveling.  The Bluetooth connectivity is so much better and easier to use than the USB dongle types. Super easy to connect to my laptop and is instantly recognized when I turn on my laptop. Size and feel are perfect.

Good solid mouse for general use; it connects easily and reliably with Bluetooth, so there's no cable or USB dongle to take a port.  Good battery life, too. Nothing fancy, but that's exactly what I wanted. This is actually my second one, replacing a worn Logitech on the old laptop.

This mouse mices with the best of em. Bluetooth connection is perfect, never had a problem. The battery it comes with is still in there, even though I've used the mouse quite often. I'm starting to wonder if it also charged batteries, too.*

*this mouse does not charge batteries

It is a "mobile" mouse and so it's a bit smaller than ideal for my grown man hands but I'm used to it already and it's fine. It's also fairly tall so it doesn't fit into my ultrabook sleeve as well as my previous mouse. (Microsoft designer mouse)
It does what I need it to do.

In all honesty I only had this about a week or so.
However so far I love it !!! I was really simple to 
set up even for a low tech old goat like me.
It seems to track very well and accurate.
Very comfortable to the hand and such.
Yes I would indeed recommend this to a friend ☺

I need to know what to do? This was a great item and all of a sudden it is dead. I reloaded drivers and tried to restart by removing the blue tooth connection but nothing is working. Of course today is Easter and you are not open, but please advise me what my next step is????

The biggest issue is with the small size which gives no rest for pinky, and I do not have big hand. The texture is a bit rubbery which provides a bit of grip, and the click feels satisfying. Bluetooth connection is reliable and wake up from sleep in reasonable amount of time.

Although I like the feel of this mouse, the Bluetooth connection is not very dependable. I've had to use the keyboard quite a lot to reconnect it, even if the mouse is on and I've walked away for a little while. I didn't expect these kind of issues with Microsoft products.

This bluetooth mouse works great and is easy to pair. It’s not a gaming mouse but is good for work and travel uses. I like the Bluetooth connection as it saves me from using a usb slot for jump drives, cables etc. the price is very good and it comes in a variety of colors

I bought this to replace the OEM mouse and a non-Bluetooth wireless mouse on my iMac. It took less than a minute to connect it to the computer and it works fine. I only wish it had an on/off switch so I can turn it off when I am not going to be using it for a few days.

I bought this mouse for office use since I'm constantly coming from and going to meetings.

It's easy to set up and use, and has a perfect balance of having enough heft but not feeling cumbersome.

Highly recommended if you're just needing good bang for your buck.

The mouse is erratic and hard to point with any accuracy at times. I have reloaded drivers and found many articles online to help remediate or improve the issue. None have worked so far, have tried settings in control panel and device manager with no improvements.

This Microsoft Bluetooth Mobile Mouse enables me freedom from wires and allows me extra room for using my laptop. I highly recommend this mouse for its mobility and wireless capabilities. The price is affordable and this is my second purchase for my second laptop.

This mouse works well with my mac mini with bluetooth. Compact but precise. Also, it's much better than some other brands from connection perspective. Previously I had a cheap BT mouse but it disconnected from Mac occasionally but this MS one is always connected.

I hate using the little track pad on my Microsoft Surface, so decided a mouse was in order. Since it only has one USB port, it would have to be a Bluetooth mouse. Investigated my options....and their prices...and decided this was a great choice and a good value.

The mouse worked well for six weeks and suddenly stopped working.
It's not a Bluetooth connection issue or a battery issue. The blue charge light glows beautifully and it is Bluetooth connected. It was great as long as it worked but not great now. Does not work.

When I need a new mouse, I look around but still always end up with a Microsoft. This is well built and feels comfortable even after hours of use. Bluetooth means no USB dongle taking up a port. No extra fancy buttons like some mice. Just left, right and wheel.

This mouse has a fantastic size. A great feature is a button to put it to sleep when not in use to save the battery life. Sometimes the button has to be pressed multiple times to be awaken so I took one start off. In overall a great product. Well recommended.

This is a perfect choice if you need a small mouse. It’s Bluetooth connection is great if your laptop is like mine and only has one USB port and need it free for your USB memory storage. It works great and the side to side scroll is actually extreme useful!

The Microsoft - Bluetooth Mobile Mouse 3600 - Black was easy to connect via Bluetooth to my Lenovo Yoga.  However, I do not like the fact that the wheel cannot continuously roll with a simple push or pull.  the click and move the mouse approach is terrible.

This mouse is good when it works! I had problems connecting this
mouse to Lenovo & Macbook. Also you can't have 2 of them out
at the same time because they interfere with each other. I got them
working on my Dell & Asus Laptops. Logitech mice work better!

Excellent advice, as usual,' from Best Buy salesman; the 
Microsoft Bluetooth mouse was easy to install (pair) with my
two year old Dell Inspiron (also bought at Best Buy).  Best Buy
had lots of products in the store to choose from, so this purchase,
with the cheerful and helpful sales guy, made the whole thing
a really pleasant experience.

this mouse is OK for general office work. However, for engineering work using SOLID Works, it is not OK. We had to revert to some old mice with tails, i.e., they are USB mice as the wireless couldn't handle all the information.

My recommendation below is qualified. I recommend the product for conventional Microsoft Office software use.

Bought this to replace you Apple mouse that didn’t bounce just right when I dropped it. Super reliable and easy to set up. Moved it to my Dell PC notebook and as with my Mac, no issue and again it’s a team player with no issues. Would like a perhaps smaller or flat version since when I carry it in my brief case it does take up more space.

i've been using logitech mice going back to the first optical mouse i got in 2002.  i've been using the m185 ever since i went cordless.i got a new computer that only had usb c ports so i had to get rid of my old mouse.  i couldn't find a logitech one in the shape i like without the dongle so i decided to try this.  i have no complains

I purchased this mouse to use with a Microsoft Surface Pro 4 and an HP Envy 360 laptop. Had no problems syncing with either computer. Very responsive and no dropping. Will not wake either computer from inactive mode, but once the computer is back up it re-connects without issue. Would recommend to any user with a Surface Pro.

I bought this to replace another Bluetooth mouse. The first one I bought was an HP and was sometimes a little iffy as to if it would work or not. This Microsoft Bluetooth has worked easily and with no problems from the start. I prefer Bluetooth connectivity over usb wireless to keep my usb ports available for other things.

I bought this mouse after a friend told me that theirs broke down and they upgraded to one that connected to their computer. So far, with little usage, it's still going. But having to remember to turn it off is annoying. So long as you have a good memory, you should be fine and it does make a difference using a mouse.

I liked the product for the short time it worked. After re-installs, driver updates and countless bluetooth checks it will not work. Its frustrating to have to buy protection for something that should actually work for a decent amount of time. I wish I'd bought a mouse from Costco, the return policy makes more sense.

Excellent product. Bought to replace my usb wireless mouse. The bluetooth worked flawlessly with Wndows 11. It was automatically recognized and worked with no issues. Usb mice have a tendency to share resources with other usb devices which can make the mouse jump around. The Bluetooth version eliminates this problem.

a spectacular mouse.... coming from the Microsoft mouse 3500 but without transceiver... not small... not big... clicking is something from outer worlds and scrolling is not hard or soft.... scrolling both directions works perfect and smoothly... signal do not drop at all.... working perfect with my surface pro 3....

I love this little mouse. I use it with a MacBook Pro (I know - Microsoft + Apple) and it's awesome. It worked right out of the box (after pairing it of course) and I don't have to worry about carrying (or losing) the little USB adapter. The mouse is very responsive and feels pretty comfortable. It works perfect.

I bought this mouse because I wanted a portable wireless mouse that didn't require me to use a wireless dongle in my Surface Pro 4's sole USB port. The bluetooth mouse paired easily with my Surface and has been working smoothly. I like the convenience of the small power button on the bottom of the mouse, as well.

Ergonomic, solid, durable! This is the second one I bought in 3 years - older one still doing well. The clicks are solid, not hollow. The best out there for the price point. The only reason for 4 stars is that the on/off button could have been a slide instead of a press-to-turn-on button, a personal preference.

I needed an inexpensive Bluetooth capable mouse to test with an iPad pro.  This definitely filled the bill.  This is a basic mouse - no extra buttons.  It worked perfectly and connected to our iPad pro in seconds.  If you're looking for a cheap, basic, Bluetooth mouse, I would definitely recommend this one.

I bought Microsoft's Bluetooth mouse since my new Dell XPS laptop lacked a USB-A port.  I'm glad that I made the purchase.  Using Windows 11 to connect the mouse to my laptop was easy. The performance of the mouse has been consistent as well.  For the price I paid for the device, I think it's a great value.

I've had it for two months and it works great. It has good sensitivity and is responsive. Connects quickly to my Inspiron 17 7000 series laptop. Although I've forgotten to turn it off a few times (once for 2 days) it's still using the original battery-doesn't appear to be a battery hog.

I really like it.

This mouse has a really great feel for a compact mouse.  I love the height but it is still small enough to stuff in your bag.  The sensor works good so far on all of the surfaces that i have tried and I love the click of the wheel.  The only thing I miss is forward/back buttons, but I can live without it.

I have had much better success with usb mice but mostly due to the device issues the mice are connected too. You cannot rule out problem will not occur with the BT feature on your device connecting to the mouse. USB always works as long as you have an open port. Go the more reliable route with USB type.

Got this mouse to go with my new laptop, so far it works very well.The bluetooth never has a problem connecting. I like the smaller size because it is easy to pack along and it fits my hand well. Most of the full size mice are uncomfortable for me, I like this size and it has all the functions I need.
Bought this mouse 2 days ago. A day after it kept disconnecting. I replaced the battery that came with it with a new battery and within a day it is disconnecting again. I am returning.

This is absolutely an excellent Bluetooth mouse. I am very picky in mice and have been happy with this one. I have used the Microsoft 4000 mouse for some time, but this one feels great if not a tad better in the hand. Have not had any major issues with pairing or responsiveness at all. Very happy.

This mouse has very stable cursor movement on my Assus Laptop in Windows 10.  It solved the problem I had with the previous mouse with the cursor moving all over the place and spending most of time trying to figure out where it was. The scrolling is also nice and stable. For my needs it is great.

Wow, I cant believe it but this product has literally done exactly what I asked for. It moves across the screen at whatever pace I command it with blinding accuracy. I am not sure if that's more of a review of my abilities or the capabilities of the mouse. I am a professional with this on my pad.

I'm been using this for a few weeks and it has been doing what it claims to do. Works with bluetooth easily so I'm not using a USB port on my Surface. Connection is easy. Battery life is good so far. Goes to sleep when not in use. I haven't noticed any delays like I've heard from other brands.

Nice Bluetooth mouse. Small and portable. If comfort is important, you will want to purchase a full-size mouse instead of this mouse.

The mouse has a single small recessed button for on, off and Bluetooth-sync. A separate rocker-switch for on-off would have been a better design - obviously. I guess Microsoft thought it was important to save $0.01 by not have a separate switch. Read the instructions to figure out how to use this combo-button. Microsoft has probably already lost money from the confusion and complexity of a combo-button.

I'm using this mouse with a new, top-of-the-line HP notebook computer with Windows 10 and Bluetooth 4.2 LE (low energy). I have experienced no problems with connectivity.

I have the cursor sensitivity set to the fastest setting and it still feels like I need to push the mouse a little bit too far to get the cursor to move as much as I would like. Perhaps a new Microsoft mouse driver will help that. I'm currently using the default Windows 10 mouse driver.

Easy to use!... Just connect Via Bluetooth and you’re good to go! Extremely responsive and smooth! The weight and feel is Excellent! And the price is spot on!..
 - Works with both Mac and PC!...

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This mouse needs upgraded. The stroll up and down does not work smoothly. It does not turn off to preserve battery life when traveling. It’s not a mouse I would recommend.

I had no problems setting this mouse up to my computer. I love that it’s wireless because everyone knows I don’t need another usb connected to my computer. My downfall is it didn’t last long being able to move the cursor where I needed it to be. It keeps getting stuck. I’ve tried changing batteries, that wasn’t the problem. I’ve tried moving the mouse closer to my computer, that didn’t help. I bought a mousepad (even though when I first used it I didn’t need to) and that didn’t help. There’s nothing more irritating than when you need this mouse to work and it doesn’t. For the time now, it will do, but I will be looking for another one.

I love this mouse for my office work!  It's not for gaming.

I purchased this Bluetooth mouse due to a connectivity issue stemming from my HP Spectre X360's connectivity issues with my old Logitech K317.  (The K317 - and the K360 keyboard - still work perfectly on every other device.)

This mouse has a constant, solid, dependable Bluetooth connection.  It is roughly the same size as the Logitech K317 which is itself about the right size for a normal-sized hand.  I prefer this mouse to the Logitech because it's less slippery on the sides and the scroll wheel.

I might have to buy a few of these to connect to my other machines.

I was in the market for a wireless mouse. I needed something Bluetooth because I wasn't about to dedicate a USB port to my mouse. I really like this mouse. It works on many surfaces: my desk, my mouse pad, & my marble kitchen table. My only wish is that it would have some auto shutdown feature built in instead of a manual power down. I keep forgetting to turn it off after use!! I'm so use to a wired mouse (if I use a mouse) my battery is dying quickly!!! I'm use to not using a mouse I haven't had to make any sort of conscious effort to remember anything. But overall I really do like it and recommend it for a good cheep mouse.

Good mouse so far.  Compact, tracks nicely, has the tilt wheel for horizontal scrolling.  Up and running quickly.  Doesn't have the extra buttons on the side that quite a few mice have, but I don't really ever use those anyway.  Wheel and buttons are a little noisier than some other mice.  Like that it's bluetooth so don't have to mess with a dongle.  Comfortable in hand.  Only uses a single AA - have yet to see if its life is consistent with product claims.  At $20, it's a bit more than the no-name bluetooth mouse I'd purchased several years ago that only recently has been losing its connection - I think I paid about $10 for that one.  Guess the extra $10 is for Bill.

Pro: I picked this mouse primarily for its Bluetooth 3.0 capability. There's no need for an extra dongle. My Surface Pro 3 picked up its signal right away. So pairing was easy. Using it is pretty comfortable. I have big hands, so using a smaller than usual mouse is not easy. Which brings up to my last point...

Con: If your looking for a compact, travel mouse, this might not be for you. I still take it everywhere, but it's not compact at all.

Overall: There's really nothing I can say about it that's bad. So far, I don't have any issues. It's just a users preference when and how to use it. It's a good buy.

I bought this mouse just over a month ago to go with my Lenovo laptop (with only 2 USB ports). It makes a really nice travel mouse (compact in size and no cords, connectors, or plug-ins to fool with), and it works great, in general, with very good resolution, but it doesn't work on glass, and sometimes it seems a little slow to respond on a non-solid surface (e.g. loose cloth). On a solid surface (like a desktop, tabletop, or tight fabric), absolutely no problems. 

P.S. Just make sure that whatever device you may want to use this mouse with is compatible with Bluetooth 4.0, the level that this mouse uses.

Something went wrong with my USB port and my wired mouse quit working. I knew I had Bluetooth connection on my laptop so decided to go with this unit. Paired easily, works perfectly. The software you can download for it adds some nice features too. 

 I would really like to have availability of a more complete manual (sorry, I’m a little bit of a control freak I like to know what I can do with my units). What comes with the unit is just a brochure showing you how to set it up, not even how to put in the battery. Online is no better as there is absolutely nothing about this particular model.

I really like the look and feel of this Bluetooth mouse. It is compact enough to carry with me, and it is large enough to give me a good stable mouse experience. I would like however, to have a back and forward browse buttons as other Microsoft mice.

Battery life seems to be very good and the status light is helpful to know where the batter is in terms of duration. The on/off button is a little tricky, need to hold for a long time to bypass the pairing stage (especially once it has been paired already). Other than that, the traction and mouse performance is very accurate.
This mouse is great and comnects easily to laptop, samsung tab, etc without usb. I bought it online and spent about $14.
Smooth. Small. It is a mouse. Has a left and right scroll feature thats handy every now and then.

I bought this microsoft bluetooth mouse after having first purchased a Logitech bluetooth mouse (one for travel, one for home). I use both with my Macbook. I have found that the Microsoft version is not as easy to manipulate as the Logitech version, doesn't roll as well, and because the on/off button is a press-down button, it is hard to tell when the mouse is off, as compared to the Logitech on/off switch. The Microsoft version is also heavier and more mounded, so it is not as comfortable in my small hand. I would not buy the Microsoft mouse again.

The Microsoft mouse simply doesnt work on most surfaces. Not on any of my tables or desks unless I press hard on a file folder on my desk. In contrast, I have been through 4 Logitech wireless mice with USB dongles and the Logitech mouse works on my couch, my knee, and any table. I will never buy another Microsoft product. I had one of the first "Surface Pro's" and it just stop turning on most of the time. When I took it in aftr 2 yrs I was told "Yeah, those first generation Surface Pro's did that. You should be able to get $50 for the cord though.

I like the feel of this mouse, and it responds quite well; the wheel is somewhat sluggish, though, but is tolerable.  The big problem I have with this item is that I have to reset the bluetooth connection frequently (often several times a day), as the mouse continually disconnects randomly from the bluetooth.  The only way I've found to get it going again is to turn off the bluetooth on the computer then turn it back on and let the mouse reconnect.  Needless to say, this really doesn't work for me.  I'll have to buy another kind of mouse.

As an individual who has no actual office space, I really like this mouse. I constantly am moving from home to the shop, coffee shops and whatnot, and this mouse fits nicely in my bag with my laptop and charger. I've used it on uneven surfaces, and as long as I have my mouse pad, have had no problems.  I like not having a cord or wifi usb bit to worry about while taking my laptop around everywhere, also less pieces to loose along the way.  The click is soft and so is the scroll, which I find is a nice perk, feels like better quality. Has good control and moves smoothly.  I gave this mouse 4/5 because it's on the small side, which is perfect for small lady hands, but I could see being an issue for men with larger hands who are looking to buy this product.

When I saw this product I thought great, I can save a USB port. I installed it on a 2016 Thinkpad Yoga and a 2017 Thinkpad E570, both running Windows 10. It failed miserably on both systems, never running for more than 10 minutes without a crash. Wasted two hours consulting various sites to troubleshoot. Having thrown away the packaging (whoever would think a mouse can fail?) I couldn't return it. Now it's in the garbage can where it belongs.  I'm sorry, but this is 2017, the mouse has to work. Stay away.

This is one of only a few truly Bluetooth mouse I've come across, and I really like it! It fits nicely in my small hand and the sides are of a nice material that lets you comfortably rest your thumb (and pinkie, if you're like me) against them without being slippery. I really like that it has a power switch, too, because I don't leaving things on when I'm not using them, so I can turn the mouse off overnight or if I'm not using my laptop for prolong times.

The mouse is perfectly symmetrical, so I think it could work just as well with predominant left hand users, so long as you can change the settings on your computer and tell it that the right button of the mouse will be the primary button (unless you don't mind using your middle finger as your primary button-clicking finger).

Mouse worked fine on a Windows 10 computer, but mouse movements hung several times on a Windows 7 Platform. In previous MS Bluetooth mouse versions, there was additional buttons above the thumb which really was handy for things like paging forward and back (default functions). Seems like no Bluetooth mouse has this anymore. Judging from the increasing amount of tablet-styled computers that require Bluetooth, you'd think the more modern mouse features should be included in the latest Bluetooth mouses.

after swiping my tablet screen a million times, and needing to clean it very often, I looked for a Blue Tooth Mouse to move me along quicker. It works very well, even using a magazine to set it on instead of a mouse pad. Family laughed when I bought it, after watching the ease of using it flawlessly, they also purchased one for themselves. Just wish the red "ON" indicator was on the top and visible so you knew when to switch it off. Other than that, buy one of you can find one, they sell out quickly
Paired up with my MacBook Air and my MacBook Retina.   The mouse obviously sits flat as it should and the mouse buttons have a nice soft click which I love.
This used to work fine, but a couple months in I cant use the scroll button anymore.  Skips up and down the page and make working on projects impossible.

I am never sure this mouse will work with my new Windows 10 laptop. I’ve had to pair it repeatedly even though it is listed as a device that is “working properly”. No mouse movements. No click. Nothing. My first attempt was to delete, then re-add it. I could not add it again until I updated Windows to the latest release - 1709. After that, I successfully re-added it, only to find after shutdown then boot a day or two later, it’s not working again. So instead of deleting it, I paired it again even though I see it plainly in the device list. So now I have 3 identical MS mice connected. I am thinking of returning it and get something else. I wanted the wireless Bluetooth so I can free up a USB port. Oh, and I am on my third battery, thinking that was the problem. It worked today. Will see if it works tomorrow. :(

Ever since the switch from rolling ball to optical laser-controlled mice, I have purchased them from Microsoft and have never been disappointed. I write this review in part with a decade+ old wired, optical mouse. This bluetooth mobile mouse is no exception. It features easy set-up, nice laser response, a very comfortable grip, with snappy clicking, and a responsive scroll wheel. A perfect mouse to pair to a laptop with a poorly implemented touchpad.

I bought this mouse to use as a multipurpose tool for my laptop, tablet and raspberry pi. Firstly, it has no support on raspbian which is the OS for the pi. Tablet and laptop use however are ok. at first the mouse was really responsive and a great asset for AutoCAD and Solidworks (modelling programs). However after a few weeks I find the responsiveness to be spotty at times. Likely because it's Bluetooth but just keep that in mind

I bought this Bluetooth mouse for use with my Mac Book Air. It performs as intended, i.e., flawlessly. As a point of curiosity, I should mention that for some reason, it fails to connect to my iMac. Strange. No impact on my review, however, since it was purchased for the Air.
Wish list: it would be nice if it turned off after a period of inactivity. As is, it must be turned on and off manually, and it's easy to forget to turn it off.

Very nicely constructed "laptop-sized" mouse with standard buttons, including an extra within the scroll wheel.
Pairs very easily with the computer in Bluetooth mode, and the tracking is excellent on all surfaces that I tried, including glass.

It uses a single AA battery which is easily accessible by an easily removable tab on the under-surface. Nearby, there is a small on/off button which activates a blue light, which will blink when put into bluetooth discover mode by simply holding down the "on" button for a short period. Once paired, the light glows continuously.
Unfortunately, there is no illumination on the upper surface of the mouse to show that it is "on", so, it's easy to forget to turn it off; however, in the rest mode, fortunately little current is consumed so that failure to turn it off will impact relatively minimally on battery life.

I have been using the MS Bluetooth Mouse 3600 for about a month now and really liking it. The interface is truly Bluetooth in the sense it doesn't require you to plug in a dongle to use the mouth, and thus frees up a USB port, which is a real plus. Pairing the device to your computer is very easy (assuming you use Windows 8.1 and up) and the connectivity is pretty good. Haven't faced any issue so far and really glad I bought it.

Most of the time, the mouse works beautifully. It is smooth and truly enjoyable to use after fighting with a couple of Logitechs that work well with my HP laptop, but very inconsistent and jumpy. The only issue I have had with this (thus the 4 stars) is that is occasionally losses contact with my PC, and the only way to reconnect seems to be restarting the computer. That can be a real pain in the caboose. Otherwise, I love it.

Mouse fits perfectly in the palm of my bigger than average hand, not too small, not too big - good travel size. Good bluetooth connectivity on a pc. However on a Macintosh, bluetooth cannot get the link back when waking up from sleep, turning on/off mouse is not enough half the time, have to set up the link from scratch again. I'm going back to Logitech for Macintosh. Still, works great for my Windows based machines.

I Bought this mouse along with my Surface Pro 4 as the tablet has 1 usb port so a bluetooth mouse frees up that port.  the mouse works great initially but scrolling is another issue. pages keep scrolling and moves in different directions when scrolling. ( reversed scrolling was not activated in settings) The scrolling is very problematic, its not smooth and does not translate to the exact movement of your finger.

Originally bought this for wife's laptop, a Lenovo ideapad. We could not make it link up. I then paired it with my Lenovo thinkpad successfully. 
I think the problem was that her laptop was originally windows 7 upgraded to 10, while my laptop was windows 10 to start with. The mouse has quick response and has an off button; to pair, hold button for 3 seconds then look for blinking light; battery life excellent.

I sort of bought this blind but I will admit it does what I need it to do. I am not a fan of it not having an on and off switch either but I have yet to use it once and it did not do what I needed it to do. It's smaller than I would like and sometimes i feel my hand cramp up but that could be due to the position of my hand than the mouse per say.
All in all it works right the first time and keeps on working.

It's very small and lightweight and was an affordable choice. It tracks well on a wide range or surfaces and has solid battery life (so long as you remember to turn it off). It doesnt have a back button, which is a feature I miss. I also have to be careful when placing it into a case or bag so that the on button doesnt get accidentally depressed as it isnt a physical switch like in previous models ive owned.

This mouse works great over Bluetooth on my Dell XPS 13 with Windows 10.

This mouse is a little small, but can be used for long periods of time. I chose this over the Microsoft Sculpt mouse because this design seems more ergonomic when in non-traditional locations like a recliner.

My connection has been stable, and I have not encountered any cursor delay.

The "BlueTrack" technology let this mouse work well on all the surfaces I've used.

There are no extra buttons, such as a back button. You may want to look elsewhere if this is important to you.

Build quality seems good, and there doesn't appear to be any exterior materials that'll wear out.

I replaced a Microsoft Wireless Mobile Mouse 4000 with this model. It is roughly the same size, and it is nice to not have a USB transmitter.

I'd highly recommend this mouse, unless you want extra buttons or a larger size.

I specifically purchased this mouse because it's Bluetooth and used different laser technology with the mouse. I didn't want to plug another device into my USB ports on my laptop cause they come at a premium. I also didn't want to use a conventional red laser mouse as they tend not to work on different surfaces. This mouse fit the bill for both and was reasonably priced. I am very happy with this mouse.

Purchased for use with a laptop that needed a bluetooth mouse. This is a compact mouse and paired quickly. No delay after sitting idle for brief periods (something that really annoyed me years ago with my first experience with a bluetooth mouse). Only complaint is that the wheel is very grainy when you scroll, and the wheel itself is very textured. Other than that, it seems like a quality product.

Mouse is exactly what i was looking. Doesnt connect if i turn on the mouse before my mac book pro. If i turn on after login in, it syncs fine. Reason i didnt give it a 5 star rating is because if you are using 2.4ghz wifi it will interfer with the mouse and cause it to skip and freeze up accross your screen. To resolve this you have to be hardwired to your router or us 5.0ghz wifi on your computer

This mouse uses Blue Track (sp?) technology and it works very well on all kinds of surfaces: fabric furniture cushion; polyester (fluffy) blanket; formica table top.  The size is right for my hand and it's more comfortable than other mice I've used.  

I like this bluetooth mouse over wasting a USB port for a USB dongle wireless mouse. 

If I ever need a new mouse, I'd get another one of these.

This is a great wireless mouse for a travel laptop. I've never had a Microsoft mouse before but I love it. I purchased it because it is bluetooth and connects directly to the built-in bluetooth in my laptop so that way I don't have the nano receiver using up one of my USB ports like most other wireless mice. BlueTrack doesn't seem to do much better than an average mouse but I'm fine with that.

This is actually my first bluetooth mouse, believe it or not.  It's comfortable in the hand and smooth. The only problem I've experience with it is that from time to time it seems to "go to sleep" and doesn't respond right away. If I move it around for a couple of seconds it wakes up again quickly and works fine. That's the only drawback I've experienced with it. I would recommend it.

Laptop has bluetooth, I didn't want to mess with losing a dongle and I needed a mouse for my kids to use.

I had no problems with pairing and the mouse appears to work fine. It's on the small side which is perfect for my children and wife (she has smaller hands), but I don't feel that it's uncomfortable for me to use (but in fairness I haven't used it extensively for long periods).

I purchased this Bluetooth mouse for the first time. What seemed like a very simple pairing became a very challenging task. Being not that techy, it took me one hour to pair it to my Dell laptop. Once paired, I started scratching my head again because the mouse is still asleep. I browsed for answers online, paired & unpaired, and browse YouTube. After another long hour, I finally found a sensible suggestion on YouTube.  I almost gave up and was considering throwing this mouse into the valley of the cats.  Now it's awake and working hard. On my 2nd day of use, I panicked because it seemed this mouse is asleep again when I turned on my laptop.  After some guessing game, I was able to determined that you have to turn on the mouse first before turning on your laptop so it gets to connect to each other.  If you don't want this kind of panic every time you use this mouse & turn on your laptop.  Don't buy this

Bluetooth mouse works with my Mac laptop, which doesn't have standard USB ports.  It's pretty small.  My biggest complaint is the middle scroll roller/button -- it seems like it's not scrolling at all, then suddenly it will scroll like crazy and pass up the spot I want on the page.  It has a side-scrolling mechanism, but it doesn't work very well because there's no fine control.

I have owned a couple Blue Tooth mouses before and this one is the best by far. Previous ones that I have owned have always lagged in their response time when I have moved them but this mouse is as fast as any mouse I have owned including a USB and a USB with a cord. The great thing about the Blue Tooth is it does not use one of your USB ports. I highly recommend this product.

This Bluetooth Mouse makes the perfect pair with newer, light laptops and tablets. Microsoft is also very reliable when it comes to mouses. The only tricky part is synchronizing Windows 10 and the device for the first time. Make sure you have all updates for windows and drivers installed and then try it. After that, you have more precision, good reach and a free USB socket.

I use this Microsoft Bluetooth Mobile Mouse 3600 as my main mouse for my laptop. It is comfortable in my hands and the battery I put in lasts a long time. FYI, the AA battery I use is either an alkaline or rechargeable. Pairing is quick and only had to do it once. Right and left buttons and middle scroll wheel function well.

No challenges with this mouse. Love it!

This is a great Bluetooth mouse. It is compact and portable. It fits well in the hand and is easy to throw in your laptop bag. It is well domed for ease of use. Only criticism is because it is so short you will find the back of your hand resting on the surface rather than on the mouse. The Microsoft Sculpt Bluetooth mouse is longer if that is an issue for you.

I purchased this mouse to replace a another Microsoft bluetooth mouse that was having trouble staying connected. I wanted to use it on a Win 7 64bit machine. The drivers for this mouse do not support Win 7, but it does work with Win 10. I am using it with my Win 10 system and managed to get the older Microsoft Bluetooth Mouse to stay connected.

This mouse is comfortable and versatile. I'm not sure how to compare my hands to others, but the mouse was big enough for me to hold it comfortably. It worked on most surfaces as advertised (glass table, regular wooden table.. even couch!). Long battery life. Wish there was a way to switch device connections. Other than that, no complaints.

My cardiologist suggested getting this unit - I have bradycardia and LBBB. It's a very simple unit, and I had it glued to the back of my iPhone for several months, taking ECG readings whenever I felt "off" or dizzy. The only correlate was when my HR fell below 40. Then I got tired of the iPhone being thicker and unstuck the unit, which I now leave on my desk and use separately. Alas, having the sensor unit separate presents its own problems - when I carry it in my pocket the battery falls out! It's easy to put back in, but I worry about it. The software app has been updated since I first got it, and I can't figure out some things that were easy before, like deleting a noisy reading. The app tries to detect if you have atrial fib, but not other conditions. It thinks my LBBB traces are "Normal" unless my HR is below 50, in which case it sort of gives up. My only other question about the system is how it smooths the data - the first few seconds of readings are really noisy with a lot of baseline drift, then suddenly it smooths out. Only sometimes it overlays a much faster pulse which it eventually decides to remove. Overall, very useful. Amazing it's so small.

On the advice of my primary care physician (PCP), I purchased this device to be able to monitor myself for incidences of atrial fibrillation.  It could not have been easier to set up and to use.  Because my phone is 3 yrs old, before purchasing, I checked the AliveCor website to verify that my Android Samsung is compatible.  I had no difficulty downloading the App.  Getting readings of my heart rate and EKG was simple--it takes only 30 seconds.  After saving the results to my phone, I can email them to my PCP.  My cardiologist viewed the saved results at my next appointment, which was useful to confirm that I had experienced one incident of a-fib. (Note: He does not provide email access to his patients, and my EKG results cannot be uploaded to the patient portal.  He thinks it is good that I got the Kardia, but advised me to only record my EKG if I am feeling that I might be in a-fib.)   When using the Samsung Health App on my phone, I often have difficulty getting a reading of my heart rate, which is measured with a finger sensor. There is no such issue on the Kardia.  Overall, I think this is a great device to have--especially during the pandemic!

My five star rating is for the monitor itself and the concept.  I use it twice a day and it saves me from taking coumadin et. al. on the off chance that my A-fib might return.  For that alone I would give it ten stars.  However, I feel that the software could badly use some improvements:  1. The iPhone app crashes much too often when taking or deleting a reading.  This never happened until Version 3.0.2. 2.  There is no way to easily discard a reading.  You have to save it first (a 2 step process), and then go through the 3 step process to delete it.  This is far too much work.  To make matters worse, the down arrow for Edit/Delete is so small  that I miss it half the time, thus adding even more steps. 3.  The web site could be very useful for observing trends over a longer period of time (I often need to view the trends in my heart rate over several weeks).  Alas, the web site only only shows 3 days/6 readings on a page (which is largely useless)  and each reading takes up far too much room on a page.  I would love to see all readings for the current month, prior month, etc. in a nice concise format.  I hope that 2016 will see some major upgrades.
