I had a few issues with connecting in the beginning, but those were addressed in a chat with a helpful associate.

As an airline pilot i'm constantly on the move. Every week I pack up my bags and fly to some far flung location. Skyroam is a genius piece of kit and one I carry with me everywhere. It keeps me connected with my loved ones, allows me to use my devices as if I were at home (impressively fast) and is small enough to carry in a pocket too.

I actually only had that Solis Lite for about 3 weeks before I had to send it in to be replaced because it wasn't working properly. That was the fourth Solis Lite that I've had that has had to be replaced due to it malfunctioning. I don't really want to be too harsh, I'll just say I think they need to be made a little (a lot) better.

Very high speed WiFi! I’m in California in the middle of the Sierra Nevada’s and its working great! There’s a reason why this thing is sold out all of the time!

Other positive features include ease of use, easy set up, good app functionality, excellent customer service, long battery life, and variety of data plans to choose from.

Bought this to replace a Verizon Jetpack that was costing me 50 dollars a month even when I didn’t use it. This unit cost less and since the data plan I picked never expires I am saving a lot of money each month. Since it always scans and connects to the strongest cell system in the area I gives the best speeds possible every time

As a full time solo traveler and travel blogger, it's essential that I always have wifi wherever I am in the world. With Skyroam, I don't have to depend on hotels or cafes to get connected; I can work from anywhere, and constantly keep in touch with my friends, family, and fans! I've used it in 12 countries so far, and counting!

The wheel was broken out of box so had to wait a few weeks for repair. But repair was good. 
The highest level of resistance is barely noticeable. It’s a notch above mechanical (not electric) elliptical because the motion is smooth. But you won’t get a resistance work out. I still get a pretty good workout just by going faster.

Im always on the go for work and this thing has been a life saver. The internet connects almost everywhere I go and it is extremely reliable. Since its bright orange everyone always asks about it, not sure if thats a positive but it sure is a conversation starter. Would highly recommend, it has made life so much easier for me.

Not sure about the solis lite SIMO 
Company 
They sent me a charging cable that doesn’t fit 
I call the company and the person said sorry for the inconvenience sorry for the inconvenience 
We don’t make the cable anymore 
They told me to buy a C Cable 
So my question is then why would you sell a Wi-Fi without a charging cable

This little device allows me to stay connected while we travel. I am updating from their old version because we love it so much! We have used this device in multiple foreign countries (no, it doesn't work on cruises though). The simplicity of having an extra boost in your pocket is unmatched by any other device I have tried!

I've tested this device from home approximately 2.5 miles from the cell tower and from my vehicle approximately 13.2 mi from the same repeater tower. Stable, no drops, no flapping, and secure. Battery life is outstanding. Impressive little hotspot ... I love this Solis Lite and can't wait to take it on the road in my RV !!!

Purchased this to use while traveling and have not been dissappointed, It is easy to use, the app works as it should as a no contract pay as you go solution. There quick courtous tech support helped me quickly on a early issue which was my doing.
I would recommend this to anyone looking for a wifi hotspot solution.

Haven’t been able to properly function this thing since the first day I set it up. Emailed the support group and was told to follow the set up instructions; this was after I mentioned I’m having difficulty with the plans. They offered little to know help. To this day it’s been connected once. Don’t waste your money

Have been using this since they launched with 4g. It is a game changer, pure and simple. Always connected when traveling, no expensive phone or data charges. If you don’t have one and travel the. You are burning money. Do yourself a favor buy one.
No data was harmed writing this review because I was on skyroam!

Just got back from a trip to Peru. I couldn't seem to activate the newer Solis Lite on most days. My day passes said zero even though I had 8. The buttons are harder to operate since there's no words, you just have to know how long to hold each one for turning on and off. You Can't start a day pass without the app on your phone, while on the old device, I could start from the device. Prefer the operation design of the older model.

I got this to use at my summer home which is in a more rural area and where I didn't want to pay for internet all year long or get into a 2+ year contract. This has been a perfect solution for me and my husband and my kids when they visit to have fast WiFi. It was simple for us to set-up and was more affordable that I expected. Would recommend for anyone else who has a second home, or especially now as back-up WiFi anywhere.

I have had a Skyroam for over 5 years ....travel to SE Asia every year ...I would not leave home without it !! It works every time and in areas where WiFi signals are weak ...indispensable ! Highly recommend for travelers...and if you have questions or problems which are few ...customer service is great ...they do what they say they will do ...Jay helped me promptly and I am extremely happy !
If you travel ....BUY ONE !

Skyroam worked great in the beginning . Fast speeds and great connectivity. By the fifth day it was almost completely the opposite. Couldn't connect or if it did was so slow it made dial up internet look fast. Contacted customer  service  multiple times was connected with high level support who couldn't  figure out what the issue was. Customer service was very friendly but if the product  doesn't  work what's the point.

Purchased Skyroam for our travels in Europe. The connectivity has always been fast. Recently had upgraded to a monthly program. Mike was very helpful and demonstrated great customer service by addressing my questions and concerns. He kept me abreast of his findings and had me back on-line in moments. In this day and age of connectivity, you just can't travel abroad without this pocket size personal WiFI. Great Job!

This portable hotspot is just as advertised.  I recently used this on a trip to the UAE and Egypt and it worked.  Yes, it was not the fastest, but when you need internet, you will get it.  International unlimited cost $99 for 1 month of service (with a speed cap at 20GB, after 20GB, you can use at diminished speeds).  I look forward to have this in my international travel bag so I will have internet anywhere I go.

Very disappointed with the connection speeds. I was expecting something better than my cellphone hotspot, instead I got something much much slower, making me wonder why I even bought this paperweight. I have only used it in the US, but if it's this slow at home with great cellphone coverage, I can only imagine how bad it will be abroad. Setup and form factor are great, but the usability truly is dissapointing.

Easy to use and carry around. I turned it in and got connected in seconds. I imagine it will be good for travel. 

The downside is that I used half of my data within the first few min (according to the app) and then just a fraction over an hour of usage, so it’s not very reliable in that way and I worry that I may run out of data when I need it. 

Overall, works well, but I’ll probably have limited use for it.

This thing is ready right out of the box and easy to use. I'm in a rural area with spotty coverage, and so far I have had very little problem getting signal. The customer service is outstanding. A real human who actually wants to help you, 24/7. I'm also a sucker for good branding and packaging. I know it's not important to some, but I loved unboxing this device. The "cool" factor with quality to back it up.

I bought a couple of the original versions before our trip to Rome and London. I had a little trouble getting started in using it so I messaged them on Favebook messenger and to my surprise, they messaged me back within 15 mins. Within about 10 mins after that I was on my way. It worked great. I have used it in Rome, London, MX, Honduras, Cayman Islands, and Jamaica and all with no problems. When the new version came out, I knew I was going to buy it. I guess when I heard it was new, more portable and a charger, I assumed it would be more compact but it’s not as compact as I hoped for but it worked just as great as before. My son borrowed it to make a large download on his xbox and he had no problems. They make it easy to buy more days and add it to the unit. Now if they could just figure out how to make it useable on a cruise ship, they’d make a fortune and control the market.

I'll preface this with, the first test run I had of this product was in Guatemala. So not the most developed country in the world, and I was in some pretty remote areas where this device couldn't get a signal, so I'm not sure if I would fault the device terribly for that. The locals with cell phones did have a network signal though, so it was odd that people could get a cell phone signal but this little device couldn't. But regardless, when this device did have a signal, it was very dependable and very fast, and I liked having my own, private, secure WiFi to use. Between me and my husband's 2 iPhones, we used about 2 GB of data over the course of 10 days internationally. The battery on the device easily lasted all day long too, and the app makes it very easy to track and see data usage and battery life. I'm sure this hotspot also works like a dream in more developed countries as well.

I wrote the company and asked which carrier(s) they used in the US because I need the hotspot in a place where Verizon and AT&T are strong, but T-Mobile is not. They refused to answer the question and apparently the answer is T- Mobile.
I bought 1 GB of data of Go Data...speeds were good. Then I changed to an unlimited day pass, speeds were abysmal, so the unlimited come as the price of speed.

two quirky things: if you want pay as you go bandwidth, you need to ask Skyroam first to lower you to US-only if you don't plan to travel outside of the country to save you the $3/GB (can't do that on your end), also if you have devices that are 5ghz and 2.4ghz, let the devices that only connect on one of the bands connect first, the device will then stop transmitting on the other frequency.

I was very excited to get this to use traveling globally and also in the US. On the Solis website they give multiple options for subscriptions and costs including cheaper US only options. All of them were unavailable to me except the most expensive global option. The rest were “grayed out”. When I contacted their services, they took days to respond and didn’t fix the issue. I returned it.

I’m on a Monthly subscription - After the high speed runs out (very quickly) the unlimited ‘3G’ connection is so slow it’s almost unusable prob 60% of the time... can’t even open a web page or listen to a call on WhatsApp... 
I understand it can’t be high speed for the whole month but the step below is unacceptable for the price . I will persevere but will not be recommending this product

This is a must have for anyone in need of a hotspot. The Solis is small enough to put in a pocket or backpack. Not only does it act as a hotspot but can also be used as a power bank. The Solis is easy to set up. There are several options to choose for the amount of gigs you want. It all depends on how you want or need to connect. The best part is the fact that there is no contract.

I have been a Skyroam user for several years now, and have been totally satisfied. The unit has been used all over the US, in DE, IT and FR. In FR, we even used it for Face Time calls from Normandy with no problems. Their customer service is excellent. I have dealt with Martha on several occasions and she is a pleasure to deal with. Overall, a great company, staff and product!

Having Skyroam Solis Lite while traveling New Zealand has been wonderful, works well for the places we've been aside from the trails. There was only one snafu when I switched subscription plans, but Tristan and Austin were able to guide me through the process in less than 24 hours. Overall, I recommend Skyroam for easy internet access and around there clock support. Thank you!

I am currently traveling through Europe and I use Solis to keep my iphone connected to wifi so I ca use it without paying international data costs. It's fantastic--the battery lasts long enough that I can wander through a city all day with it on and charge it at night. The wifi is fast and reliable, and my Solis always starts up in less than 5 minutes. So glad I got one!

I've been concerned about hotel wifi when traveling in the US and Europe. So I decided to buy the Skyroam Solis Lite. It works great and connects quickly. Exactly what I need for travel or if there's a problem with my home internet. My phone and computers connect easily. And Skyroam has daily or monthly options for using it, at reasonable prices. Definitely recommended.

This has done what I need it to do, and that is give me internet in more places. I like that it switches between carriers to get the best signal. I've seen it switch between AT&T and T-Mobile, but never Verizon. The documentation doesn't mention carriers at all. While the data seems expensive, you can buy it in blocks that don't expire with is great for infrequent use.

This product is awful! We bought this to have wifi on trips as we are constantly on the go and work remotely. Unfortunately, the signal is pretty terrible everywhere we have tried it. Additionally, it is spotty, constantly disconnecting. Half the time it doesn't connect with the app either. Not worth the money at all. Do yourself a favor and look for another product!

Bought this for my father-in-law for all his biking trips abroad.  Often times, he stays in remote b&bs with limited wifi so he is super excited to have this.  Until those trips resume, we have actually been using it a ton to support our work-from-home setup when power goes out or too many of us are on video conferences at the same time.  Would definitely recommend!!

I bought it directly from them. It is a great device, I used for social media and work in several states and I always get decent speed and coverage. I recommended it a lot. Only thing you have to look harder if you want to pay for exact plans, I didn't get the option for US on the application from my smartphone. I better go to their web shop and buy a voucher there.

Bought this for my father-in-law for all his biking trips abroad. Often times, he stays in remote b&bs with limited wifi so he is super excited to have this. Until those trips resume, we have actually been using it a ton to support our work-from-home setup when power goes out or too many of us are on video conferences at the same time. Would definitely recommend!!

Bought this hotspot for a quick road trip during quarantine. Because my company is all working from home, my wife and I took advantage of the flexible working hours and environments and ran away to Tahoe for a few days. We had to maintain full productivity from the bed of our truck and campsite, which worked surprisingly well with this little gadget. We had both of our laptops and a kindle connected the whole trip! My wife even streamed episodes of The Office on the drive up there.. "Working from home" just got a lot better.. : )

Bought this hotspot for a quick road trip during quarantine. Because my company is all working from home, my wife and I took advantage of the flexible working hours and environments and ran away to Tahoe for a few days. We had to maintain full productivity from the bed of our truck and campsite, which worked surprisingly well with this little gadget. We had both of our laptops and a kindle connected the whole trip! My wife even streamed episodes of The Office on the drive up there.. "Working from home" just got a lot better.. : )

Solis resolved my fear of being hacked while using hotel or Free Airport WiFis. Now I carry my own hotspot and I can relax knowing my connection is secure. I have used it in many, many countries and the connection has been great in all of them…even the most remote! I’m not sure how it works in US as I don’t use it there.
It is easy to use, cost effective and the battery charge lasts all day.  My travel companions (3) can connect and as long as they are close to my Solis they get their WhatsApp and email. I’ve never been so popular!! 
This is my second (upgraded) hotspot from this company and I have been totally satisfied with both. 
Great customer service helped me transfer unused daypasses from old model to new without issues.
It solved my travel problem and it can solve yours!

their website (set up) is cumbersome. Since this operates on cell service, if your cell service isn't great, connectivity isn't either.  If you sign an auto renew and want to upgrade your plan, you have to cancel (and lose data) in order to be able to upgrade. This can also only be done when you are in range of the unit.  I expect it will be useful when I travel since I don't connect to public wifi. even with the negatives, I would still recommend it as a decent alternative to public wifi or no wifi at all

Bought the Solis Light when they offerred day passes in the US. There is a hidden 1GB limit. You get good service until that limit is hit, then you cannot even stream a Youtube Video.
I am sure this is done to make you upgrade to a more expensive plan. If I wanted to buy a more expensive plan I would have chosen a 5G plan through my current carrier. The day pass
approach was exactly what I was looking for until this limit showed up. Don't waste your money on this device if you want to use the day passes.

I knew the internet service in the small town I am in would not be very stable or good for calls so I got a skyroam hotspot to help alleviate any issues. I've been using it as my lifeline for work as I have to be online and on zoom calls pretty often during the day. Although I have been able to connect and take video call, often the audio cuts in and out and my teammates have trouble hearing me. I'm using it be I have to but my friend has another hotspot that works better and was less expensive.

I got Skyroam Solis Lite as a backup WiFi. While it is great for staying connected when traveling it is also handy at home. Now that everyone is working from home, if I need a little escape or need to go somewhere quiet. I can take it to work from the backyard or a park. It works great! It is light, easy to set up and you can connect many devices. It is affordable as you can get day passes as and when you need them. Looking forward to using it when we go on road trips this summer.

It was AMAZING to use in Panama, Brazil, and Argentina! It worked like a charm. It saved me resources from having to get a SIM card for my phone! I'll be using this baby every where were I can't get access to WIFI!

I LOVE the many plan options. You can subscribe, pay as you go, or buy a day pass!

The device is sturdy, small, and simple! It doesn't take long to charge up!

The hotspot is strong once you get it to him up!

Overall, this is a wonderful purchase! I would buy again!

I bought the Solis-Lite 4G LTE Flobal Wi-Fi hotspot for summer Arts & Craft markets to ensure I had a secure internet connection.  If I use it I cannot use my Square to accept payments.  The Customer Support from Solis/Skyroam is non-existant!!!  The website doesn't work as it NEVER lets me sign in, even changing my password EVERY TIME I want to log in.  The device works great on our patio, but is not an option for a secure connection when used in conjuction with a Square.  I hope it works when we are camping remotely, but I have yet to try it.  Maybe it would be a good thing if it didn't work.  I am trying to 'turn off' the service until summer, and I cannot even get in touch with the company to do that.  If you buy this and have success with it.  I hope you'll include that in your reviews.  Good Luck!!!

It was helpful having wifi, however the device constantly dropped the connection. We had to keep on reconnecting and had to switch our cell data off to avoid being charged when it automatically switched to data after the Solis device dropped the wifi connection. The speed was ok. It took a while to boot up each time turning it on. The size was fine. Not small enough to place in pocket but ok for a bag. It did seem to get very hot when using it and had to try cooling it down.

I bought a subscription for the 20GB's at high speed and after hours on the live chat and sending screen shots of the speed never reaching close to 1mbps after wasting gig upon gig of what is supposed to be high speed I was told I would be emailed and compensated. Its the following day and still no email or compensation and my connection still keeps going out or buffering or wont connect and wont ryn past .57mbps. Last I checked it was .37. Dont waste your money or sanity.

I recently purchased a Skyroam Solis hotspot for use while traveling internationally. In short, the product is excellent, and customer service is impressive. I have used the hotspot in Dallas, Dubai, Kolkata, and Asansol (plus other locations in the US) and have never experienced any trouble getting internet connectivity. The only time I had to contact Skyroam support, their response was prompt and efficient. Thank you Biron and Rain. I would highly recommend this product.

I purchased a Solis Lite for a trip out too Lake Powell and I was blown away with how well it functioned. I've used a few other hotspots through carriers in the past and would ALWAYS lose my connection. I can honestly say I did not lose my connection once while on my drive from San Diego to Utah. Battery life was top notch as well, I used the device for a total of 6 hours on the road and got home with more than 80% left. Can't recommend this device anymore, very content!

Skyroam is a game changer if you travel! After years of stressing out about changing SIM cards etc to get connectivity while traveling, my friend recommended skyroam. Now all I do it turn it on before I leave my hotel/apartment and I am always connected to work, voip cell service and texting. Small form factor so you can put it in a jacket pocket and have wifi at all times. Customer support answers quickly and is very efficient. Great product and company---many thanks!

I bought this device to work from the beach in Miami. It worked perfectly. The reviews kind of scared me because people were saying it’s not the best device but I had no issues getting service anywhere there was cell service. I choose this particular device so I can work internationally (after covid when it’s safe) without having to search for another SIM card. I highly recommend for people working from home and want to be able to travel and work from wherever you are.

I bought this device to work from the beach in Miami. It worked perfectly. The reviews kind of scared me because people were saying it’s not the best device but I had no issues getting service anywhere there was cell service. I choose this particular device so I can work internationally (after covid when it’s safe) without having to search for another SIM card. I highly recommend for people working from home and want to be able to travel and work from wherever you are.

This hotspot has been great for me since I've been working from home during the pandemic. I use it on my rooftop, where my home WiFi does not reach. Also, sometimes I take a Zoom call from the car when my kids are being too loud inside. We recently took a road trip to Montana and it was great to have WiFi for the kids so they didn't smoke the battery using my phone hotspot. The best part about it is that they use multiple networks and I don't need a physical SIM card.

purchased to use while camping. connection quality was good and was able to use 1 device connected. any other connections would greatly slow down the system. do not expect blazing fast speeds with this. found that it was not even good enough to stream when settings were at sd quality and ended up having no use for it. it does work as expected and the daily global pricing was best option. i like that you can pay as you go so your not wasting money when not in use

On 11/19 Saturday I bought a 1GB pay as you plan. I used it for 1/2 mainly browsing websites. Both my phone and MacBook use low data mode for Solis. Next, the app says you have no plan. If I exhausted the data, it should say that. There is no visibility in what device used how much data. There is no support, the app live chat support no one responds. The return windows was 14 days so stuck with this device. Overall, I cannot recommend this device to anyone.

We used the Solis on a recent Baltic cruise. The device did not work on the airplane and the cruise ship when it was out at sea because of the lack of cell towers. However the device worked well when we were in port as well as at the various port stops.

We used the Solis in Copenhagen, Stockholm, Helsinki, St. Petersburg, Tallinn, Berlin and Oslo and the device worked well in all these cities. We are an older couple and we had no problems setting up the device. We charged the device every night and so did not run out of battery power. The wifi signal was strong and we were able to surf the internet with ease.

On two occasions I phoned the support line (1-855-759-7626) and received prompt, polite and useful advice. I would not hesitate to recommend the device to friends and I would also use the device again when I am travelling.

From the moment I started using Skyroam from my friend's hotspot, I already loved this item! I loved it so much that I even bought my own! There were few issues but the Skyroam team were there to assist and got me on track right away. You wont regret using this especially if you are the type who travels internationally like JP, Korea, Guam, etc. I have yet to explore the stateside but if their signal could reach internationally what more in the states?!

This little device was great on a recent road trip - I was able to work from the car while my partner was driving. The only frustrating thing is that a few times, (when switching carriers I guess), it would drop the connection for a minute. I got cut off in a couple meetings, but it always got me back online quickly. But overall, reliable, convenient, FAR better wifi than I’d get using my phone as a hotspot, and the daypasses are affordable.

I just came back from a 2-week trip spanning Penang Malaysia, Bangalore India, and Singapore.

The Solis Lite worked really well in all 3 locations. I used mostly for navigation w/ Google Maps, looking up information, checking emails and social media. The unit had plenty of power to last probably 2 days.

The only trouble I ran into was in Singapore whenever I turned on the unit, it would take 3 to 5 minutes to find a network to connect to.

Having the Skyroam while abroad was so helpful. A constant supply of WiFi helped us travel around foreign cities without getting lost and allowed us to keep in touch with our relatives at home. Occasionally the Skyroam would take a few minutes to connect to our mobile devices, but it never deterred us from going somewhere. We would simply take the Skyroam with us knowing that our devices would connect automatically in a couple minutes.

I've been really disappointed with my Solis. I bought it to use in a major city in Mexico, and I still get only 1 bar of connection, even when I used the feature to connect to a variety of networks. I contacted their support and asked why my cellphone and others around me get full service, but i don't through the Solis. They essentially told me that it's good enough, even though I can't get a stable connection for conference calls.

It's really helping with the humidity in my room and bathroom. I'm impressed that this little thing sucks up as much water as it does. It's even helping my carpets (which I just did last night) dry faster.

When added to Google Home you only get the option to turn the device on and off. Problem is by default the dehumidifier option is off so you can't control this remotely.

Will update the review if this is fixed.

Connection was as easy as enabling bluetooth and connecting to the device. Connectivity is strong and I havnt disconnected yet.  HiFi sound quality is always amazing. Once you go HiFi, you can't go back lol

It definitely works well and we can get a lot of humidity out of our rooms. However, it hasn't fixed our condensation problem on the windows in the winter. But definitely increases air quality, so that's good.

Helps keep the washroom from feeling damp and there's no longer a musky smell. Noise is minimal and the wet towels dry quicker with the dehumidifier running during the day. Very satisfied with my purchase.

Helps keep the washroom from feeling damp and there's no longer a musky smell. Noise is minimal and the wet towels dry quicker with the dehumidifier running during the day. Very satisfied with my purchase.

i have this running in my bathroom 24/7. The tank fills up and auto stops once every 4-5 days for me. Great little unit to keep molds from growing since i dont have a working ventilation in my washroom
The unit works overall, helps remove the excess humidity in the air. But I have to empty the water every other 3 days, they should built a drain hose in this thing so I can just leave it on 24/7
I’ve had the machine for a few weeks now and it’s great for my basement suite. The humidity in my one bedroom suite has gone down 8% already. Not too loud and a great size. Highly recommended!
I did bought this Dehumidifier a years back from JS Innovation (not from BestBuy). It does not work that well as I expected. Price is also seems very high to me compared its performance.
This is perfect for a very small room that we wish to keep the humidity down in. It is also very quiet. Love that there are different fan speeds for days when you need an extra boost.
Unit works, to a certain degree. It is a bit smaller than what I expected. Doesn't make much of a difference when used it the living room. So far I had to use it inside the basement.
Unit runs very quiet in the background while sucking alot of moisture out from the air. Could be my imagination, but I feel like the room smell alot better now.
Love these little units, very portable and can move it around the house. So far I got one in the bathroom, the den and the basement. They are quiet quiet so you barely notice it.
My mom got this for me after visiting my place and seeing the condition of my washroom. Gotta love my mom for this! Never knew the moisture was creating molds in my washroom.
This mini Vanguard works perfectly. Quiet and easy to service. We live in a very humid climate and use it in the bedroom. You can really feel the difference. Recommended.
Hands down the best looking dehumidifier on the market. Great that it also acts as a air purifier. Works well albeit smaller than I thought, so its good for my kitchen.
Good little machine. It collects a good amount of water and is quiet. It is small though, so take that into consideration when determining which room you need it for.
Works great. I bought it for my baby's room who will arrive soon. The room has stayed nice a dry. No dampness. I love this dehumidifier, works great. Very quiet.
I had the original Vanguard unit purchased in 2018 which recently died. Not bad, lasted almost 5 years, hopefully the 2.0 version will be just as long lasting.
Air purifies and dehumidify, hard to beat combo. Only wish they got a bigger unit, cause currently I can only use this in my bathroom due to its small sizes.
Great little dehumidifier. I'm using this in the front sun room at a lake cottage where it gets damp. This little unit is quiet and does the job nicely.
Got delivered quite fast. Unit easy to use and works as per intended use. Removed the excess moisture in the kitchen for sure. A big plus for a good design.
I experienced some minor issue with my dehumidifier unit, but their customer service team is very responsive and addressed my issues in a timely manner.
Bought this just over a year ago now, and I'm soo happy with it! It's small but mighty, and I'll be buying another one (for a different room) soon!

This device works pretty good as long as it's up your butt or in your shirt pocket. No range at all. I was 20 ft away from this device in another room and could not connect to it. The same issue for other family members in other rooms of the house. Kept it for a couple of days to give it a fair chance. The limited range of this device is very poor. I imagine you could connect 10 devices to this, if it were five people holding two devices standing shoulder to shoulder in a circle!
I know now why they charged me a $45 restocking Fee, because many people are trying to return them. The almost 40% restocking cost is to deter you to even return it.

I bought this for a temporary internet connection.
I live in the Los Angeles, County and always got a strong signal. 
Not good for gaming, streaming, watching Netflix or youtube you should probably just install regular internet at home. This will cost way more to run.. for example $6 per GB
Works great for checking email and internet sleuthing. 
The battery power depends on usage but for now I can probably get 10-12 hours of battery power.
Customer service has been helpful.
 I reached out through the online chat messenger
 and got help within minutes.
There was some trouble shooting and resetting that came up but they walk you through it .
.
Good little wifi box, will never have to worry about searching for a signal again.

I love this portable WiFi device. It is perfect for travel or even when I am working in my backyard - my new work from home office. It is easy to set up using the Solis App. I use the pay-per-day option for data so that I am only paying when I need to use it. It saves me money when I travel internationally too. I no longer need to purchase my cell service's international travel plan. The Solis connect up to 10 devices so in addition to my laptop I use it with my phone and then use WiFi calling. It is so light and portable I just stick in my bag or back pocket.

I bought the Solis Lite with expectations that were pretty tragic. I expected the quality to be about cell phone wifi hot spot level, which I hadn't realize was so lousy until I tried to actually stream music through it. The Solis Lite came into my life and legitimately I was blown away by how great it functions. I've had zero connectivity issues in western Massachusetts, USA, and the speed has been greater than I had hoped, and stable. I've recommended this product to a few of my friends who are now probably sick of me raving about it. Thank you, Skyroam, for making such a great little device and providing this service!

I bought my Skyroam Solis to take with me on a cruise. Cruise ship wifi is extremely expensive! We were able to use it in all the ports on our Panama Canal cruise from Vancouver to Fort Lauderdale. We could even do Facebook updates all the way through the canal. Fantastic! No more looking for free wifi after leaving the ship. When at home or traveling, I take it with me when hiking or even when doing chores around town. Wifi is always with me in my car. I can’t say enough about Customer Service. They are awesome! I’ve demonstrated how easy to use this device is multiple times. I should get a commission! Great Product!

This is my second Skyroam I have purchased. I was really happy with the new smaller design however the device and service has really let me down.
I have only used the unit 3 times since I purchased it once in Bucharest once in Warsaw where I simply could not connect to the service. This was poor but I have had trouble connecting other devices in those countries 
But the biggest failure was in HK where I connected really easy but the Unlimited day Pass was so slow after the first 30 mins it was unusable. I was tempted to purchase unlimited monthly passes but I’m so worried that the service will be so slow it will not be worth it.

Massive disappointment, Can I return It?

I have been very disappointed with my SkyRoam. I bought it specifically to make WiFi calls and send emails for work while traveling internationally. The service continues to be extremely unreliable despite people around me being able to connect to and use the cellular network for the same activities (and more) than what I am trying to use it for. Support was working for a bit, but now my chat with support refuses to work whenever I don’t have WiFi for calls (even though I have enough WiFi to stream music). I emailed support via the website yesterday to express my frustration problems and have yet to hear from anyone. Please do yourself a favor and look at other products.

This works well but only in a T-Mobile or AT&T cellular area. Could not get it to connect in my town (Verizon area) until I drove about ten miles outside of where I live. Once it connected it worked fine and did what it is suppose to do. Worked with their customer support on live chat and first he said it wouldnt work in a Verizon area and then few minutes later said it should still connect to any tower. He said he reset something on his end and said to power down and wait. Still didnt help. Tried mutiple times. Dont try their emal. They say they can help then tell you to use live chat after a couple emails. I selected yes for would I recommend but it depends where you live.

I thinkg Solis Lite wifi service is terrible. 

I've been using the service for about six weeks, and have already experienced dozens of dropped connections, which is more dropped connections than I've experience in one year using Solis 1, and more drop connections that I've experience with several other wifi services combined, over the past 13 years. 

Sometimes I'm fully connected to wifi with 5 bars, but the communication tower isn't responding, so I'm not able to navigate the internet. I have to shut down my PC, shut down the wifi device and reboot. 

If I had not been forced to switch from Solis 1 to solis Lite 5g, I wouldn't be using Solis Lite.

The service is not stable.

This is such a great idea and device. It's only at 4G, sadly. However, as always the midwest has issues with towers connections strength being weaker than heck. How it works is it will connect to the strongest provider and you can use their connections. It's either TMobile, AT&T, One Cellular like towers. I bet it is way better overseas like Europe or Asia since networking out there is top notch. Plans are great deal and affordable. I was using unlimited per day pass so it doesn't throttle like the 20G per month.

Anyway until it has 5G+ and towers are update maybe be useful in the USA deadzones. I recommend only if you travel a lot and need to do most the work you could on the go.

Loved the original one I had but this one has been terrible!!! It heats up then stops working and you can’t even turn it off!!! Very dissatisfied. 
Had to purchase a esim as the divorce was not reliable!!! 
Support told me not to connect too many devices!!! I only had it connected to my phone!! 
The original one worked so well and was very stable so I don’t know why this new one is not working as well!
Even when at the Hotel and I’m using it in my phone it heats up terribly!
I also told people this was an amazing product but I’m not happy with the new one I have! I am only 1 week into my trip snd it really only worked gif the first 3 days!! Then it started heating up and no internet!!!!

When you turn it on, you have to install an app on your phone on which you buy the data. The hotspot uses that connection to give you internet on any other devices. You can buy it up-front in small packages or have it auto-charge. I did both options at different times - did you want to watch a movie on Netflix? My paypal was dinging so much that I didn't even get through a movie without my balance being at $45. I live in SF and my cell service is Verizon. I must've used it twice successfully, and all other times unsuccessfully, and I needed it to do my work! The Solis people were unresponsive to my emails for help or through the app. What a disappointment, and when I needed it to do my work, too.

This little device allows me to stay connected while we travel. I am updating from their old version because we love it so much! We have used this device in multiple foreign countries (no, it doesn't work on cruises though). The simplicity of having an extra boost in your pocket is unmatched by any other device I have tried!

My Cell phone service (t-mobile) was MUCH faster at one location (4 bars of 4g) but the device would not connect to the faster service and would only connect to a 1-2 bar 4G after multiple tries/restarts

Data options are inadequate for my needs. I’m on a lot of Teams calls and can go through up to 5GB or more a day, and throttling makes it impossible to connect to meetings. Even the 20GB plan runs out in less than a week.

Not a useful device or solution for my needs, but also did not do a good job of connecting to the best available network even for minimum needs.

After issues using our mobile carriers' international service on our first international trip that caused us quite a bit of grief, we swore off using them and looked for a different option. This little thing was exactly what we wanted! It's small and easily fits in my bag that I carry around(and would fit in most purses), the signal was almost always stellar, and the speed was fast enough for all of our needs. It felt like the battery was lasting as long as advertised, and then it charged up fast when it was low. The global day passes worked great for our needs and it saved us some money because we could both connect to it, as compared to us both having to buy individual day passes from our mobile carriers. 15/10 recommend!

I love this portable WiFi device. It is perfect for travel or even when I am working in my backyard - my new work from home office. It is easy to set up using the Solis App. I use the pay-per-day option for data so that I am only paying when I need to use it. It saves me money when I travel internationally too. I no longer need to purchase my cell service's international travel plan. The Solis connect up to 10 devices so in addition to my laptop I use it with my phone and then use WiFi calling. It is so light and portable I just stick in my bag or back pocket.

Just can't say enough great things about my Skyroam Solis. I had been looking at this for quite some time and finally decided to purchase it for travelling to JP. Used it for the first time in Tokyo everywhere with no problems. Speed was fast and the ability to charge my phone was invaluable. Needed to use Google Map constantly 12-16 hours per day and never lost my Solis wifi connection even in the Tokyo train and subway stations. The battery life was excellent even when I had to charge my phone.
If you travel, this is a must have. It's an excellent product.
Best

Great little WiFi hotspot!  I bought this for my international travels.  In January 2022 I traveled to Barbados and Saint Lucia in the Carribean and this little guy worked exceptionally well.  As soon as I landed I was able to turn it on, connect to the WiFi and effectively have internet to get in touch with my hired shuttle driver and my friends.  The battery lasted pretty much all day and allowed me to get internet on my phone at the beach, in the ungle, wherever I needed it.  In about two weeks I used a little over 1 GB of data, but I had a bunch left from purchasing 20GB during Black Friday :) Very convenient for frequent travelers who don't want to have to worry about purchasing new SIM cards each time they move to a new spot.

The device is easy to set up and use. It has decent battery life. The app is ok, I don't love the interface but it gets the job done. 

It is slow to connect initially as it scans the network which is frustrating as I am mostly using this as a backup for when my primary internet goes out.

The speed is unreliable, I mostly use it for Zoom meetings and it usually starts fine but within minutes I get messages saying that my internet connection is unstable or slow. 

I wish I could also check my data balance and usage on their website as I don't always have my phone handy when I need to use this on my laptop.

It's great for casual use while traveling to check emails and browse the web but I am not impressed for remote work as I use Zoom a lot.

I have set up several hotspots and this one was by far the most difficult.  I had to set up at least 2 new accounts to get into the installation process.  I was following their easy instructions but got hung up on reading the QR code.  I would scan it, after 20 seconds I got the message 'Oops. It didn't work.  Try again later."  I know I tried at lease 15 times and always got the same message but no explanation of what was wrong so I assume it was on their end.  I tried their online help and I never could find anything about that error message.  I used the online support and got the message that they were not online.  I spent at least 4 hours  and finally reached my frustration breaking point and returned the item.  Easy instructions were not.

We are in Italy, and the internet seems very spotty. We reconnect multiple times per day and have a terrible time getting an ipad connected. Talking on WhatsApp means lots of pauses to "reconnect." Doesn't seem to matter where the solis is located (our balcony is one of the highest points in our little town). It's working OKAY, but I'm not sure I'd try taking it to Africa or a less populated country (like somewhere in South America). 

After all the WhatsApp pauses, we haven't tried to stream any shows; figure it would be too frustrating!

I love my skyroam.  It is very easy to use when I need to.  I am a teacher and teaching from home due to the pandemic.  I bought this because I don't have to buy a subscription plan also.  The other day the internet went down in my home and I was able to buy a 24-hour pass that allowed me to have wifi for just when I needed it.  The only issue I have come across is that you need to be fairly close to it.  My children on the other side of a small house were not able to pick up the signal.  All in all, I am happy to have it just in case.

I have been a Skyroam / Solis customer since close to the introduction of the first hotspot - about 2010. In that time period, I have bought and used three hotspot devices (now using Solis Lite). I have had no problems with the device or service - ever. I keep a Solis always active for local internet outage backup. And, I have used Solis in France and Japan with great success. There have been a few times that I needed to contact customer support. Each interaction was exceptional. Consider me a veteran Soliser and devoted customer.

This is a great product that was recommended to me by a friend and I am happy with it. It is a nice portable size that I can easily move it from bathroom to the kitchen and to other closets that need dehumidifying. Works all day long and collects a few cups of water every two days. Actually I am going to order one more : )

Really happy with our Vanguard 2.0—it’s really helped bring down the humidity in our home this winter. While we don’t notice the air purification as of yet, am happy to have this feature, and looking forward to having it come wildfire season. 
The most satisfying part is seeing how much water is pulled from the air!

Really happy with our Vanguard 2.0—it’s really helped bring down the humidity in our home this winter. While we don’t notice the air purification as of yet, am happy to have this feature, and looking forward to having it come wildfire season. 
The most satisfying part is seeing how much water is pulled from the air!

Bought this for our boat. Have been using for a week andso far, so good. Takes care of moisture on windows and generally smells fresher.  I have already recommended to neighbouring boaters. I commend you on the fast shipping….it came in 2 days while my christmas pkgs are still….well, who knows where?  Thank you!

Bought this for our boat. Have been using for a week andso far, so good. Takes care of moisture on windows and generally smells fresher.  I have already recommended to neighbouring boaters. I commend you on the fast shipping….it came in 2 days while my christmas pkgs are still….well, who knows where?  Thank you!

I love this little dehumidifier. I live in a manufactured home and my laundry area would sometimes have a musty smell. I placed this small dehumidifier on the self above my washer. It has absorbed excess water and any odor is totally gone. And it takes very little room. Great product at a great price!!

This product is exactly what the description says it is - quiet,small,easy to use! I plugged it in immediately after opening and it worked just like it was supposed to. The water unit is a little small,but the instructions say it will turn off as soon as the water is full. Overall,great buy!

I've been looking for one of these for ages and i am surprised i couldnt find an air purifier and dehumidifier 2 in 1 machine on the market!! what about people who live in a humid environment?! Anyways im so gald i bought this. It works great and exceeds my expectation. Would recommend.

I'm just confirming the other positive reviews. We're using it in our small bathroom and it is taking out quite a bit of moisture from there plus some from the air in the rest of our home. Effective and relatively quiet at removing odour from the air. Impressive for the price.

I have used this product for a month now. I think it is best suited to a small space - as it doesn't seem to be too effective for our 20' x 20 bedroom. Still, some humidity is definitely being pulled out of the air since there is a small pool of water in the collection tank.

I tried this machine at different rooms in the house and found that it works better for rooms around 200ish square feet. When i had this machine running in a room about 350ish square feet, i didnt' really notice any difference even though the tank accumulates water. Just my 2 cents.

We live in a home that is about 50 years old and had problems with several damp rooms. When these little dehumidifiers showed up I had no faith in them, but boy was I was wrong. Every room we have one in is perfectly dry!!! This is a great value not only for money, but for space.

Did not have it for long enough, but i feel the air is better when i have it on for an hour. Used the dehumifier once only and it seems ok but do not have much. But happy to have found a smaller version (small apt) which was cheaper to invest on as well. And cool looking

Did not have it for long enough, but i feel the air is better when i have it on for an hour. Used the dehumifier once only and it seems ok but do not have much. But happy to have found a smaller version (small apt) which was cheaper to invest on as well. And cool looking

It has made a world of difference to both dust and moisture in our small pace! 
The low fan setting is nice and quiet and even the sound of the higher fan setting is not unreasonable. It is an effective little piece of equipment and we would definitely recommend it:)

The dehumidifier works great! I'm primarily using it for a 4x4 grow tent that keeps my humidity low to prevent plant mold. I will probably pick up a second one for my bathroom since this one works so well & I've started to see a little mold on the walls.

I was surprised to see how small this appliance was when it arrived. But it did not disappoint! I use it in my bedroom and it works great. The small size is an advantage and its super quiet. It would be ideal for any small room or bathroom with limited ventilation.

Product is good, easy to use manually and not too noisy.
But if you link him to Google Home, you can only activate the purifier program and not the dehumidifier program, or the intensity.
I bought it for this reason, it wasn't clear, so I'm not satisfied.

Love this thing. It's pretty quiet on the low an medium setting. On high, it sounds like a white noise machine. I did a very thorough cleaning of my house yesterday. And I am pretty allergic to dust. Let me tell you that the air was so clean. I love it.

The unit is small and portable. Making it perfect for moving around the house for targeted moisture control. I leave it in the guest room overnight before I have guest over, but most of the time I keep it in the basement area to keep mositure in check.

My apartment does not have AC and it gets sweltering hot in the Summer. The JS Vanguard helps to reduce the heat trapped in the moisture in the air and cool down the room and also clear up my sinuses. This is a great buy for all having similar issues.

Overall the unit is great, working fine in my basement. 
However, the app is not most useful. Instead of spending the money to have a chip in there for an app, maybe they can install a sensor in there that will tell the humidity. Just a suggestion

It does a great job, and the customer service was so helpful when I had an issue with my product. I will recommend this brand to anyone! The dust level is noticeably lower and it gives me peace of mind living somewhere with wildfires. Thank you!

My unit had some issue after I accidentally dropped it. The fan started making weird noises. Contacted their customer service team, they were able to send me replacement fans and instructions and replacement. Solved the issue within a week.

I knocked over the unit last month and it rolled down the stairs. After the unit wouldn't work any more. I was able to send it back to them for repair. It took a lot less time then i expected, now I have a working dehumidifier again.

Bought two units over the holidays. One for me and one for my brother. 

I used mine in the basement (as many reviewers suggested), but is barely getting my water tank filled. 

My brother use his in his basement as well, and for some reason it fills up in like two days. 

At first I thought it was my unit that had issue, so I swapped it with my brother. Still, nothing. Bizarre. 

I guess when it works these things work incredible, but doesn't work everywhere?

Excellent! Works perfectly. Needed it for our master closet because it is in between the bath and laundry room. We also have one in there too. Our home was built with sprayed on insulation in the walls so humidity is high already. These mini dehumidifiers are perfect. The reservoir fills after about 2 or 3 days to be emptied, and it is so quiet..I had to put my hand on the top to check it. No more smelly clothes. It also keeps our bed room smelling clean.

Four stars may not be fair to the product, because I expected too much. The area where I'm using it is under the front porch, concrete on all sides, so more damp than a comparable living space of that size, but quite small for a conventional dehumidifier. In a closet or other small living space, the Vanguard would probably be fine. Its quiet, uses little electricity, and accumulates water in the reservoir, so it's doing its job as advertised.

I bought this for my bathroom and it malfunctioned (we still aren't sure why - it seems to be working fine), seeping the collected water out the bottom all over the floor. My wooden floor swelled from the moisture and now the bathroom door cannot fully open, so it will need to be replaced, resulting in hundreds of dollars of damage. I contacted the seller and they did not even apologize. They just said I could ship it back to get a refund. Terrible.

This is a small unit as described and perfect for a small bedroom. In my case I need to keep a guest room as dry as possible and it really does the trick. I have to empty the reservoir about every 3 days. Pull it out of the box. Plug it in. You are in business. It's that easy. It seems to be well built and so far communications from the seller has been helpful and frequent. I am very happy with this purchase and will buy more as needed.

We bought this unit because of it's size. We live in a condo apartment that gets lots of condensation on the windows when the weather is cold and doesn't have the best air circulation because of he use of baseboard heaters. We use the 2 in 1 in one of our 150 sqft bedrooms. The dehumidifier is not excellent but good and the air purifier good. Yes, I would recommend this product but for a smaller room. And, it is quite quiet. too... a bonus!

Love it! It dropped the humidity down from 73% to 53-56%. We loved it so much, we just bought another for the living room. It's extremely easy to use. Just plug it in. It shuts off automatically when full; I dump it out, then turn it back on. Best of all, it's small and unobtrusive. I highly recommend it for a room. We are using two for a 780 sq. ft. apartment; one in the bedroom and one in the living room. Price is reasonable too.

I got one of these amazing little devices for my small 300 sq ft home this past year and this is the FIRST year since moving to Nova Scotia that I have had a mould free spring and fall. 
Quiet, super energy efficient and exceptionally effective!
 I was so impressed with the purifier/dehumidifier that I went ahead and bought the small space heater and am delighted to report that this too is super efficient, effective and cute as well.

I had so much humidity in my bed room. It's impressive how much water we have in the air. The water tank is full every 2 days in my case at the maximum power. I'm so happy because this problem is solved. For this, thanks a lot.

 The only thing is that's a little bit noisy at his maximum power but is not a problem for me. I can even sleep like that but if you are more sensitive, you can use the lowest power to sleep.

I bought this because I recently tested and found out one of my rooms had alot of moisture in the air.

Bought this to help de-humidify it and prevent mold from growing.  

Works perfectly, I can hear the water being emptied into the little dish at the bottom of the machine and it auto-shuts off when the dish is full. Easy enough to empty it and restart the machine. 

Also doubles as an air purifier which is neat.

It does the work, a bit slower than I would have liked, but it does draw the humidity from the air. 

Not the best use if you use it in a large room, though the water tank will build up, you won't notice any drastic drop in humidity.

I would recommend this in a small room like a bathroom, it perform much better there. 

My wife suggests we use it in our RV, so maybe I will try this in there come spring.

So good. We got 6 of these. Bedroom, Bathroom, kids room, closet, and project room. Wish the reservoir was a bit bigger. The closet and bedroom fill up once a week. The others fill up twice a week. After having to repaint our bathroom, bedroom, and closet, this was a great addition to reduce the moisture in the house. It does a great job at cleaning the air so the whole house basically smells great.

No complaints for this dehumidifier whatsoever. It quickly brings down the humidity in my bathroom and is practically silent. From 90% to 55%in 15 minutes! Iâve only had it for a short time and I run it very often for long periods of time and so far it holds up great. It also arrived very quickly to my house which was great because I needed it urgently at the time. Very satisfied customer!

I want to like this product as it has a great design. The air purifier part functions great but the water tank is rather small. It only holds 1 L of water. I had this put in my outdoor 20'x30' shelter and the water tank fills up too quick. I had to dump this out every few days. Only recommend if you use this indoor.

We are using this dehumidifier next to our baby crib since his monitor detected high humidity. The humidity went down the same day collecting lots of water in the box. It is a small appliance but get its job done. Not only that it is also quiet and a good subtle white noise machine for our baby who has been sleeping so much better and has also helped with his eczema.

Great little device! In The first 12hours, it sucked almost one-half inch of moisture from the air in my sewing room. I would highly recommend this machine to anyone who has a small space that needs drying out.  It reduced my allergy quite a bit. I can sleep better without stuffy nose. I wish the light of the power button was dimmer. I like it dark when I sleep.

This works!!! I'm buying another one for our other bedroom. This product has helped with my husbands allergies and I know this will help with my brother's asthma. It's a mini and it doesn't take up much room on my bookshelf. It has this really soft humming sound which I don't mind because it helps me fall asleep. Plus, plus, plus all around.

Pros:
comes with a built in Air Purifier
can run only the air purifier if required
has a silent mode for a quiet night
has a simple app, that you can use to control the device, that can also be integrated with Google Home

Cons:
only worthwhile if its on sale
when on High speed, it is a bit noisy
not necessarily a con but, could do with a bigger water tank.

Bought two of these units and they work great. One in a bedroom and one in the kitchen. Could probably use a bigger unit but these are small enough to require minimal space. Noise level is a personal observation but to me, I would call it a quiet "white noise". They are not loud. I would recommend them if asked. We have had them in use for a week so far.

So far, i love it... we keep it running all the time. I feel it works, I forgot what it was like before; life seems drier now lol. When it is time to change the filter.. so that will be interesting to see how easy and how dirty. I will buy one for the bedroom if it is easy to replace filter. it has 2 speeds.. it is quieter on the low speed.

I ordered this for my boyfriend due to the moisture that builds up in his basement apartment. It helped a lot with the moisture levels. It was very easy to use and could basically be plugged in right out of the box! It was quiet for the other systems out there. Shipping was fast and the product was better than I expected! Thank You!

Mildew has been a constant problem that I have had in my closet, so bad that it has turned some items green and causing a weird odour. I realized that prior dehumidifying methods were not adequate and decided to purchase a dehumidifier. This unit is awesome as it dehumidifies as well as cleans the air. Great for my bathroom issue.

I love this compact dehumidifier! We live in the damp NW and our bedrooms seemed to always feel cold and damp. I ordered one unit for our master bedroom and after loving it so much, bought a second unit for my girls' room. It is easy to use, quiet, easy to empty, and super compact. I would definitely recommend this product!

We purchased this for our 20 ft rv trailer. I was surprised at how much moisture it is pulling. We live on the coast with lots of humidity - it looks like we will need to empty it every couple of weeks, but with the auto turnoff when full we don't need to worry about being late to get to it while in storage. Perfect size.

I have 2 cats in my small apartment that tends to be a little damp so I was looking for something to keep smells to a minimum and to hopefully cleanse the air of any mold spores. I have two of these working at the same time. They are really quiet, perfect for someone who doesn't really like ambient noise while sleeping.

I live near a fairly trafficked area with cars. There is also a brewery nearby. Within two hours of running this little devil my room smells great, and I can take deep easy breaths in with no raspy feeling that dusty and pollen gives me. Being that I have a small canine the room also always has a smell of dog. Right now my room smells like fresh air you get a whiff of on the way to the ocean, before the salt, but in between the city smog and the clean breeze of the coast. Very small and light weight. I think my favorite part is there is no superfluous options, though I'd of enjoyed having a timer to set it so it would turn off after an hour of being out of the house.

I live in the Pacific Northwest and after leaving one of my cars parked outside for a couple months without driving it I noticed that mold was growing on the fabric. I put a digital thermometer/humidity meter in the car with the dehumidifier running. After a day 2 cups of water were pulled out of the air in the vehicle. I emptied it a few more times with less water each day over a week and now the humidity is down to a level where mold will not grow. It would also be great for a gun safe since it is quite small but does pull a remarkable amount of moisture from the air for it's size. I'm not sure how well it would work for a whole room since I only used it in a small space but my experience so far has been positive.

I need dehumidifier since my I have asthmatic reaction to humid air. I have chosen this unit because of combination of features, air dehumidifier and purifier in one. I left my place for about a week with machine on, accidentally. I did not worry a lot since it was said that it should automatically shut off at water tank overflow. Well, when I came back the overflow light was on, but machine was still running; all counter space was flooded. Huge disappointment!

I intentionally bought this air purifier/ dehumidifier, because I was hoping it would make noise (in addition to it purifying the air and draining water of course). I work grave shifts at my job, and I prefer to have a more natural sounding white noise other than what a smart phone app can provide while I'm sleeping during the day. It actually wasn't as loud as I was hoping. I ended up switching it out for the one in my daughter's room, and it seems to work great! It seems to work well in the amount of space, is easy to use, and makes enough noise to be her sound machine without being overwhelming during the night. If you are looking for one that is completely silent, however, this maybe isn't the one for you.

I suppose it works as advertised, but it doesn't pull water out fast enough to change the humidity in our bedroom more than a few points from ambient. In other words, if relative humidity outside is 60%, the lowest this unit will bring RH in a room is about 55%. If you plan to use it in a room with a draft, or any room bigger than a small bedroom, you will want a bigger /faster drying unit.

The purifier/dehumifier arrives 4 days earlier than the expected delivery date. Excited! 
The design is very beautiful and modern. The control panel is touch sensor and can be controlled by your smartphone. This is very nice and convenient. 
The noise isn't loud. 
The size is appropriate, not too small, not too big. It fits perfectly in my bed room. 
The value and the quality is amazing!!

This is a great little unit! I moved into a 2 bedroom apartment that was so humid it was uncomfortable. I didn't want to spend a ton of money or get a large dehumidifier due to limited space and because winter will be here soon so I thought I would give this one a try and would pass it on to my brother for use in his RV if my place was too big for it to handle. I knew it wasn't really built to handle an entire apartment so I wasn't expecting it to be perfect but it has made a measurable improvement and is the perfect size for my needs. It's super quiet and reliably shuts itself off when full which was also important to me. Rather than buying a large unit I would recommend starting with one of these and adding a second one later if one isn't enough.

Ran this in the living room (~400 SQ FT) don't seem to notice much differences. Was about to return it, but my wife placed it in the bed room the other night (~150 SQ FT), I noticed the difference in air quality at night. Will keep it for now and see.

I accidentally fried the innards when I plugged a high-powered oil heater into the same outlet as this device. It tried to keep going but just couldn't.
One week later I had a new device and it is now working perfectly on a separate outlet from the heater. All is good. 
I've noticed a decrease of humidity from average 60's to 50's and lower when this is in working order. I empty it every 3 or 4 days. I'm breathing much better now that's back in place.
Kudos to the customer service team for making the return and inspection an easy and pleasant process.

Pros: 1) Small and lightweight = portable and can take into any room easily. 2) 2 in 1 function means one less machine to buy. 3) Does what it advertised to do.  Cons: 1. Small means it's only good to use in smaller rooms 2. Filter is non-washable 3. Water tank is 1 litre (i have to dump out once every 7-10 days)
I love this unit and its design,but I want to use it for a larger spaces. I end up using 2 for 2 different rooms. Please make one large enough for the whole floor!

I live in the basement where the air circulation isnt that great and moulds was forming due to the dampness of the air so i was told to try a dehumidifier. This device also acts as an air purifier so i decided to give it a try and it works great.  This dehumidifier function works fairly well. I didn't realize how small it would be. I feel that it takes a long time to gather up a good amount of water. It did it's job, just really small and takes time to gather water.  The air purifier is a simple HEPA filter. Nothing too special but it works.

I purchased this for my office. I moved into a new building and my office was stuffy and humid. It's not large, only about 90 square feet. I only run the dehumidifier when I am at work but it has made a noticeable change in the humidity in the room. I am surprised about how much moisture it pulls from the room. What sealed the deal was this also cleans the air! Double Whammy!  While I can't say how this would work in a large room or house, I recommend it highly for anyone trying to get humidity out of a small room or office.

I bought the Vanguard 2-in-1 Dehumidifier/Air Purifier just over a year ago due to a moisture/mildew issue in one room (12' x 8') in my basement suite. I'm very impressed with how well it has been working this whole time. The unit is quiet, compact, and portable (I can easily move it to other rooms, for example, to dry my paddleboard😊). Customer service has also been amazing -- fast & friendly responses and prompt delivery -- and a quick resolution to a Canada Post error. I definitely recommend this product and company!

I've been using the dehumidifier for two weeks and have had to empty the water container twice already. This tells me that the machine is working wonders in removing humidity from our master bedroom. Since using the machine my bedroom and closet does not smell mildewy. Saving a lot of money not having to buy Damp Rid anymore!

Unit is small enough to fix on top of the toilet so we can get rid of excess moisture in the bathroom. The tanks fills about every few days, and you can just slide it out to empty. Also quite enough in low power mode that we can keep it running all night long.

I ordered 2 of these. One for each kids room. They both live in the basement where signs of molds were beginning to grow probably due to the humidity.   My son, 8yo, has wicked environmental & dust allergies and also had a cold when we got this. I put this in his room and literally the next day his sniffles were gone. So were his under eye âshinersâ. He especially loves the night light feature and the white noise.  We got a separate humidity detector and now our basement air is nice and dry.

This here Air Purifier/ dehumidifier is awesome for my small apartment. But I knocked of a star do how "Loud" it is. I want to run it on a higher speed however do to the amount of headaches/migraines I get from my allergies, the noise kills more often then I liked. I live in a very wet high allergen area and was hoping to get some good clean air in this OLD  home, that has happened. The noise I can most of the time tolerate but there are times I Have to shut it off and risk bad air.

I've been temporarily living with a friend, and the bathroom I shower in does not have a ceiling blower to divert steam out of the room. After using the shower, the large mirror in there would be completely useless due to the steam and condensation. I saw the littleVanguard and decided to give it a try. I had my doubts because the unit is so small. However, it does the job and the mirror is clear after showering. The unit is whisper quiet, as well. I'm glad I purchased it.

Great little dehumidifier and air purifier combo. Runs pretty quietly and does a good job of pulling moisture out of the small room that I have it in. I would not recommend this unit for anything larger than an average size bedroom. Overall the quality is good. and the automatic shut off works just as it should. Emptying the collected water is very simple with the reservoir just sliding out of the back of the unit. Perfect for closets, bathrooms, bedrooms, and other smaller rooms.

I've been using this air purifier/dehumidifier for a month now. I would say that it's been working very well so far. This summer has been rainy so it can get mildly hot and humid in my apartment. I was using those moisture absorbers (with the white beads) from the dollar store for a while, but I felt like it wasn't sufficient in really sucking the moisture out of the air.   I use the JS Vanguard in my living/dining room (approx 240 sqft area) or my washroom which can get quite damp (no windows). I typically leave it running while I'm at work and it accumulates about 1/4 of the small tank of water. I've also left it running over the weekend if I'm going away, and it accumulates over 1/2 a tank of water. I've yet to let it fill all the way.   In terms of air purification, I don't have any pets and there aren't any particularly terrible odours in my apartment, but I've noticed there is a lot less dust gathering on the floor of my unit, so I am very happy about that. Before using this device, I'd have a lot of dust gathering each week.  All in all, I'd say it was well worth the money. It's a beautifully designed appliance that functions very well.

I bought this to help with this musty slightly mildew smell I could smell everytime I came into my room and it drove me nuts... I tried all kind of things and of course it didn't help much. So I looked into getting a dehumidifier/ air purifier but didn't want to buy one that was too expensive. So I came across this little baby and it actually helped keep that odor at bay! Especially since my bedroom is right next to the bathroom. Helped out more than I expected !

I purchased this item to put in a 30×30 inclosed baseroom where i do some minor wood work. The room has concrete floors & a low ceiling. Humidity level and air level gets terrible down here.  I've only had the product for 2 weeks. Every 4-5 days it fills up with water. I can feel a difference when I go into the room. I think if the room were bigger the product may be too small. For the price & what I've seen so far I think it's a great product.
Great for small spaces or a bedroom, super easy to use and the google assistant function works great!
Works great. The water container gets full in a two or three days!

I am 68 years old and still getting comfortable with using devises. The thought of having to figure out how to set up a scanner and remembering how to use it was overwhelming. Your product is so user friendly, this scanner has become my new friend. It may sound lame, but I feel so smart and confident when I go through the steps to scan something. DONE! I'm sure there are many other people out there who feel the same as I do. My advise is just read the instructions they are really easy! Thank-You!

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product for free from Brother in exchange for my honest opinion/review of the product. After using the scanner for the past week I am very happy with it. It is a lot more compact than having a printer/scanner combo which is nice when I have to travel to worksites. The instructions are easy to follow and it`s size is very nice. I also like that it was very easy to set up with both my personal apple computer and my work PC, making if a great multifunction device.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The DS-640 mobile scanner is a mobile scanner that can be carried anywhere. This unit is powered through your computers USB port. The software is just a download away. The DS-640 scans directly to your computer to a default folder. You can also download the BR-Receipts program, this makes the scanner even more useful. As you can scan to a data base and sort your receipts by date and vendor name. I have tried both ways of scanning my receipts and I prefer the BR-Receipts app.

Disappointed I had this brand in the past but their software needs to be updated. You can’t edit an image while you are scanning it so you have to have a different program just to crop the picture. Also if you are scanning a 4x6 you will have a massive white border. Basically it scans an 8x11 so anything smaller will have white all around it but hey you can’t edit it to crop it when you scan it in you have to save it then open up in another program to edit not worth it

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Scanner is great once you get the software installed. Produces a great graphic image of whatever is scanned, e.g. picture, text etc. 

Installation of the software took some effort. Finally went to the Brother site, choose my scanner model, opened the quick start guide .pdf, clicked on the link for the software (same as url on page 2) and was able to get it installed. Did receive a few errors along the way, choose continue and the download/install continued.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product for free from Brother in exchange for my honest opinion/review of the product. This scanner is super easy to set up and also easy to use.     I have used it to scan some recent papers - and it worked great for those.    I also used it to scan a bunch of old photos and documents.    This was a little trickier, but the results were satisfactory.This is an easy to transport, portable scanner.  A good addition to my office

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product for free from Brother in exchange for my honest opinion/review of the product. I`m very impressed with the quality of this scanner for its size.  Lugging around a huge printer-scanner in my car was starting to wear on me. Now I just slip it into my backpack along with my laptop.  It is perfect  for my needs. Portable and only required a USB .Load the drivers before you plug in the USB device and it`s ready to go.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a high quality mobile scanner. Very easy to initially set up and start scanning. It is simple to either scan single pages or multiple page documents.

I especially like the ability to not just scan to my computer, but also to be able to push the scan to the cloud of my choice. Very cool.
